As a TrueSense Data Analyst I, the ideal candidate will be challenged with analyzing data and working within relational databases, including various customer meta data and transactional information to support multichannel marketing initiatives across a variety of media (direct mail, site, email, events, search, telemarketing, etc.).

The role will revolve around the application of valid analytic techniques to inform and enhance client marketing performance across their fundraising portfolio.

To succeed in this role, the candidate is expected to demonstrate analytical thinking, logical reasoning, strong technical aptitude with software applications, and an ability to communicate and present, at times complex, data findings in a way that promotes general understanding.

Essential Functions:
Executing a wide variety of analytics projects including donor profiling, lifecycle analysis, segmentation review, campaign analysis, and ad hoc data exploration.
Extract and process large quantities of data from our data warehouse and other data marts
Analyze marketing metrics to identify cause-effect relationships between marketing levers and outcomes ability to answer the What happened and Why
Data mining and analysis, including the ability to independently QA database information and help drive database enhancements via communication and requirements documentation for our Data Solutions team
Turn complex data into practical and actionable marketing insights
Support development of efficient and accurate summary reports
Develop and tune queries and packages within our SQL Server-based data warehouse environment
Ability to discover hidden insights or complex patterns through data analysis
Position Requirements (Knowledge, Skills and Abilities):
Appreciation - Is transparent and honest with team members, appreciates differences between coworkers in thought as well as style, and shows respect for others and their ideas.
Communication - Demonstrates excellent use of the English language (grammar, syntax, vocabulary); possesses the ability to communicate effectively and continuously with internal as well as external customers; composes clear/complete emails. Strong presentation skills preferred.
Computer Proficiency - Strong computer skills including all Microsoft products (Outlook; Excel; Word; PowerPoint). Excel power-users preferred
Job Specific Programs/Functions as Applicable: BI or other analytics tools (SAS, Python, R, Tableau, TIBCO Spotfire, Adobe analytics, Google Analytics, Power BI)
Congeniality - Positive attitude, not easily discouraged, open to alternative views, accepting of coaching/peer input, and copes well even under pressure.
Customer Service - Anticipates the needs of others as well as clients, acts upon those needs appropriately, and help remove barriers to excellent customer service.
Industry Knowledge - In-depth knowledge and understanding of direct-response best practices, strategy, and tactics.
Innovation - Pursues better ways of getting things done, models breakthrough thinking, acts as a change agent, and helps others manage through change. Ultimately translates the department vision into actionable plans and creates enthusiasm about the future of TrueSense.
Modeling - Acts as a role model for others and actively participates in the development and mentorship of teammates/direct reports; positively influences others while providing motivational support and direction where needed.
Personal Development - Demonstrates personal growth and learning; acknowledges mistakes & learns from them.
Problem Solving - Digs in to problems, investigates all aspects, gathers facts, and recommends solutions.
Professionalism - Is visible with a positive presence, is ethical, and highly professional.
Project Management - Can be trusted to troubleshoot all job processes, manage timelines and inventory needs, anticipates issues, effectively multitasks, and follow through with all tasks to completion.
Team Mentality - Works in a coordinated effort with other members of the team in order to achieve overreaching goals, models collaboration, instills effective team membership in others, and allows for flexibility in how work is accomplished.
Education and Experience:
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent
Minimum of 3 years of experience in analytics in the direct response marketing arena a must

Lutron Electronics Company

By 2020 experts predict up to 200 billion connected devices worldwide serving a community of smart homes and connected buildings. We at Lutron pride ourselves on contributing to the IoT market. Lutron has control solutions for a wide variety of lighting, energy savings, and shading needs, from a single room in a home to a multi-building campus.

Here at Lutron we have been at the forefront of IoT and technology innovation. We are looking for talented and motivated individuals who want their voice to be heard and their work to make a difference. Whether your interests are in user experience design, data science, machine learning, systems engineering, mobile development, or cloud services, Lutron has a career path to help you achieve your goals.

Why Lutron is a great place to be a software developer:
Youll have the opportunity to take ownership of tasks and projects, contributing to solutions from up-front design through deployment and delivery.
There are a wide variety of new and established technologies to learn at Lutron. You can build iPhone apps, Cloud-based .Net web applications, or work with Go in our latest projects.
Lutron is an established global brand that continues to grow world-wide, so your contributions will reach commercial and end users in countries all across the globe.
We have a variety of paths and leadership opportunities that you can pursue to advance your career. In addition, youll be surrounded by other bright minds that will constantly challenge you to attain new heights.
Lutron is a privately held company that isnt subject to the whims of the market. This gives us the freedom to pursue strategic, game-changing initiatives rather than chasing short term profits.
Your Contributions at Lutron:
Architect stable, efficient, and scalable software upon which world-class user interfaces can easily be built.
Design maintainable, elegant, and lasting solutions to meet a wide variety of requirements and feature sets while working closely with a team of other highly skilled engineering professionals to deliver top-quality software to the end user.
Balance a variety of tasks related to: requirements gathering, user interface design, protocol and communications architecture, database and object model design, software development, testing, trouble-shooting, and software maintenance.
Mentor and coach colleagues to expand the effectiveness of those around you.
Assure a high standard of quality in your own work and in the work of others on your team via good coding practices, process improvements, clean designs, smart testing and review practices.
What were looking for:
BS in Computer Science or similar, with at least a 3.0 GPA (or equivalent)
You have had at least 5 years experience developing software in a corporate or start-up environment.
Familiarity and hands-on experience with various design patterns
Excellent communication skills so that you can work collaboratively with other disciplines
Skillful at solving problems with enthusiasm and creativity
Willingness to travel 10% of the time, sometimes with little or no notice
Technical experience required in a majority of the following areas:
Object-oriented programming concepts (encapsulation, polymorphism, interfaces, etc.)
High-level programming languages such as C++, C#, Java, Objective C
Algorithm design and run-time analysis
Asynchronous programming techniques
Basic user-interface design
Web technologies (REST-based web services, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript)
Database design (table design, stored procedure development)
Lutron Electronics position as the leading manufacturer of lighting controls worldwide, our unsurpassed quality, the breadth and depth of our product offerings, and our commitment to servicing our worldwide customers have resulted in double digit growth annually. This growth has in turn allowed the company to continue to invest in recruiting and retaining the best people we can find to service our customers. Continuous growth has also fueled our ability to constantly develop new technologies and new manufacturing processes that in turn drive the creation of new or better products and services.

Lutron offers a competitive compensation and benefits package and a dynamic and professional work environment. We also offer continued growth through increased job responsibilities, courses offered through Lutron University and advancement opportunities. For more information, view our website at www.lutron.com. EOE/AA

job_description:
Company Summary

Crown Castle works around the country to build and maintain the infrastructure behind the worlds most revolutionary technologies. Crown Castle owns, operates and leases more than 40,000 cell towers and over 60,000 route miles of fiber supporting small cells and fiber solutions across every major US market. This nationwide portfolio of communications infrastructure connects cities and communities to essential data, technology and wireless service bringing information, ideas and innovations to the people and businesses that need them. Crown Castle is an S&P 500 company and one of the largest Real Estate Investment Trusts in the United States with an enterprise value of approximately $60 billion.

Position Summary

Crown Castle is hiring a Data Analytics & Reporting Analyst within our Business Support team. Are you passionate about using data to drive decision making? Are you intellectually curious and like to ask "why"? Can you take data and make it speak? Do you like to visualize data and use storytelling to create presentations and analysis? If so, we want to talk with you.

This position will provide insight for planning through, compiling, analyzing and interpreting data on our workforce and the markets where we work. In particular, this position can add significant value through combining data from all internal systems and other sources to produce a holistic view of evaluating investments in business innovation, redesign of processes or organization design, or possibilities for new ideas.

Critical Core Competencies

Collaborates
Ensures that stakeholders remain well informed and that surprises are eliminated.
Identifies and enlists a wide variety of stakeholders who can add value to team outcomes.
Urges others to share their ideas and input; expresses strong appreciation for these contributions.

Communicates Effectively
Delivers even highly complex information in a polished, precise, and compelling manner.
Exhibits verbal and non-verbal behaviors that indicate a deep interest in others comments.
Acts as a source of information; proactively disseminates knowledge, insights, and updates.
Creates rich documents and reports that skillfully and completely deliver the necessary information to stakeholders.

Business Insight
Regularly scans the marketplace and discusses the potential implications of changes.
Uses multiple methods to stay well informed about business developments.
Has a sophisticated grasp of business drivers; finds novel ways to increase own contribution.
Stays attuned to the business and industry; ensures that own decisions and activities remain closely aligned with key objectives.

Drives Results
Is passionate about achieving excellent results and contributing significantly to organizational outcomes.
Consistently drives initiatives/efforts to successful completion and closure in an extremely timely manner.
Remains focused on achieving key goals, even in the face of obstacles and setbacks.
Regularly pushes self to achieve outstanding outcomes; consistently establishes bold goals for own performance.

Strategic Mindset
Takes industry and market trends into account when making decisions.
Knows what to prioritize for the greatest strategic impact to the organization.
Appropriately balances time between big-picture/strategic concerns and day-to-day activities.
Explores possibilities and potential scenarios that may impact the team or organization in the future.
Expected to Deliver
Partner with the business to understand and deliver on their data needs, such as standard reporting, workforce planning support, executive level analysis and recommendations.
Develop and maintain standardized dashboards and other related metrics reports for organization-wide evaluation and decision-making support.
Help develop, implement and support an Analytics strategy to expand the amount of high quality analytics and insights through the organization.
Utilize technology and analytical tools to develop, analyze and interpret workforce data.
Develop, test and deploy predictive models for business outcomes related to talent and people analytics.
Liaise with leaders to share analysis and insight into workforce trends and demographics.
Analyze data and produce reports that help in facilitating talent review meetings.
Evaluate data to find root causes of trends, shifts in population distributions, etc. to drive strategic improvements.
Ensure quality assurance and data privacy compliance by performing data cleansing, data audit, and/or data validation.
Identify and implement process improvements in relation to data processes.
Recommend ways to strengthen data integrity, quality and availability.
Create reports in support of Compliance reporting submission requirements.
Support the Business Support team with various projects, ad hoc reporting and data analysis as necessary.
Education/Certification
High school diploma or equivalent.

Job Description

The newly formed Computing & Information Science (CIS) Department at Mercyhurst University seeks to fill two tenure-track faculty positions (preferably at the Assistant Professor level, although exceptional candidates will be considered for the Associate Professor position). Candidates must have a PhD in computer science or a related area (ABDs will be considered). Our department currently offers masters degrees in cyber security and data science. While all area of computer science will be considered, preference will be given to candidates who can teach graduate cyber security courses (especially in an online environment). In addition to the cyber security courses, there may also be opportunities to teach data science courses as well as general CIS courses. The teaching load is 6 graduate courses per year. The position carries with it a competitive salary and benefits commensurate with qualifications and experience. The new faculty members will join a vibrant department that is experiencing an exciting period of growth. This includes the development of a $1 million state of the art cyber-center that will provide CIS faculty members and students with world-class facilities for teaching and research. We are also developing undergraduate and online programs. The new faculty will also have opportunity to contribute to these programs. For more information about these positions, please contact Dr. Afzal Upal, Chair of the CIS Department at 814-824-2117 aupal@mercyhurst.edu.

How to Apply

The initial review will begin immediately and continue until the position is filled. Applicants must be currently eligible to work in the United States. Applicants must send a letter of interest, resume/curriculum vitae, and teaching philosophy to:

Dr. Afzal Upal, Chair

Department of Computing & Information Science

Mercyhurst University

501 East 38th Street

Erie, PA 16546

Fax: 814-824-2020

Email: aupal@mercyhurst.edu

Mercyhurst University is a fully accredited, comprehensive institution, founded in Erie, PA, by the Sisters of Mercy in 1926. The Erie campus, located on a picturesque hillside crowning the city, offers 50 undergraduate majors with 67 concentrations, as well as unique adult programs and eight graduate programs. U.S. News and World Report ranks Mercyhurst 13th among more than 180 colleges and universities in the region for “Most International Students.” Meryhurst’s Ridge College of Intelligence Studies & Applied Sciences is the world's largest full-time academic enterprise educating intelligence analysts for government and the private sector. Mercyhurst University has been ranked among the top 50 best colleges and universities in the area of education and teaching programs, according to a leading resource provider of higher education information, the Community for Accredited Online Schools. Mercyhurst University is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer that encourages members of diverse groups to apply.

job_description:
Join us on our exciting journey!
IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward.
The Analytics Center of Excellence
Our new Analytics Center of Excellence (Analytics COE) harnesses our global healthcare insights, working closely with our clinical and therapeutic experts to power evidence-driven design, speed site activation and recruit the right patients, faster. This is a new unit within our business, integrated within Clinical Operations. We’re using big data and advanced analytics to derive insights that transform clinical development and bring new medicines to patients faster through successful trial delivery.
This multi-functional team is an innovation for our business, requiring entrepreneurial and independent thinking to build our capability. Unique and with a global view, this Center of Excellence is a chance to revolutionize the clinical research industry.

Machine Learning Engineer – the role
This is a new role designed for a new and unexplored environment. Optimizing machine learning and deep learning algorithms, you will have petabytes of data, state of the art hardware such as massive distributed clusters and GPUs, and professional support to develop ways to design complex and efficient models. Clinical development is an untapped domain space for modern data science so this position offers an opportunity to make a large impact on the industry.

You will be working with a small group of advanced machine learning researchers and while collaboration will be essential, there is a great deal of autonomy and home working may also be an option.

Your typical activities might include:
Primary resource for internal distributed machine learning software questions from the machine learning team.
Implementing deep learning, machine learning, and data mining algorithms on distributed platforms.
Automating machine learning algorithms within the production environment.
Designing new algorithms to find predictive patterns that combine heterogeneous data assets.
Working with electronic medical records, healthcare claims, clinical trial data, and unstructured text data.
Working with technology teams to support machine-learning algorithms in big data platforms.
Supporting customized projects by designing and implementing algorithms and statistical models on related datasets.

Qualifications:
Our ideal candidate will have:
A Masters’ degree with several years’ experience or a PhD in software engineering or related field.
An in-depth understanding of machine learning algorithms and modeling.
In depth experience with Spark/Hadoop and either Theano/Tensorflow/Caffe/Torch.
Experience in Python and R.
Experience creating production environment data analytics and applications.
IQVIA is an EEO Employer - Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled
We know that meaningful results require not only the right approach but also the right people. Regardless of your role, we invite you to reimagine healthcare with us. You will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve human health outcomes.
Whatever your career goals, we are here to ensure you get there!
We invite you to join IQVIA™.

job_description:
Position Information
Position Spring 2019 Assistant/Associate Professor of Data Analytics
Posting Number FM01798
Employment Type Regular (Probationary/Tenure-Track)
Full Time or Part Time Full Time
Campus
Department Computer Information Sciences (CIS)
Contract or Position Start Date 01/07/2019
Job Summary/Basic Function

The Department of Computer Information Science in the College of Business Administration and Information Sciences at Clarion University of Pennsylvania invites applications for a tenure-track Assistant/Associate Professor of Applied Data Analytics to begin spring semester 2019.

The successful applicant will play a key role in refining the curriculum and teaching all courses in the new Minor in Data Analytics. The focus of the program is the application of cutting edge technologies to uncover hidden patterns, unknown correlations, market trends, customer preferences and other useful information that can help organizations make more-informed business decisions. Application will be favored over theoretical foundations and we expect graduates of the program to be able to apply these skills to problems in their domain specialty. The ideal candidate will be excited about the opportunity to expand the current master’s curriculum, develop the data analytics minor, and help define its future including the recommendation of specific technologies and tool sets used throughout the curriculum.

The Department of Computer Information Science offers B.S. degrees in Computer Science and Information Systems as well as the M.S. in Applied Data Analytics and minors in data analytics and web development. The Department has seven tenure-track faculty and roughly 170 majors. More information about the Department can be found at www.clarion.edu/cis.

Clarion University, has a 4/4 teaching load. Opportunities for teaching during winter and summer sessions exist. A record of excellent teaching, successful scholarship, and meaningful service is expected for tenure and promotion.
Required Qualifications

A Ph.D. in Data Science, Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field is preferred and is required for tenure. Outstanding candidates with a master’s degree and significant industry or teaching experience will be considered. The successful completion of an on-campus interview and classroom demonstration is also required. Candidates are expected to demonstrate excellent oral and written communication skills.
Preferred Qualifications

Recent industry experience in data analytics is preferred as well as evidence of excellence in teaching and the ability to teach a variety of courses in the Data Analytics programs at the undergraduate and graduate level. Additional qualifications include research and teaching interests related to areas such as data management (including database systems, NoSQL database systems, Big Data, Hadoop, etc.) and business analytics (including exploratory and inferential statistics, data modeling, data and text mining, data visualization, predictive modeling, and prescriptive analysis).
Special Instructions to Applicants

Review of applicants will begin on September 7, 2018 and continue until the position is filled.

Candidates must provide a curriculum vitae, a letter of application that addresses your qualifications and experience for the position, and three letters of reference.

All applicants must apply online at https://jobs.clarion.edu .
Additional Information

The successful completion of an on-campus interview and classroom demonstration is also required. Candidates are expected to demonstrate excellent oral and written communication skills. Prior to employment the successful candidate will be required to obtain and submit current clearances from the Pennsylvania Department of Human Services, Pennsylvania State Police and the FBI.

Applicants must apply on line at https://jobs.clarion.edu

Clarion University of Pennsylvania is committed to equal employment and equal educational opportunities for all individuals regardless of race, color, sex, religion, national origin, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, or other classifications that are protected under Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, and other pertinent state and federal laws and regulations. Direct equal opportunity inquiries to the Director of Social Equity, Clarion University of Pennsylvania Carrier Administration Building, Clarion, PA 16214-1232. E-mail asalsgiver@clarion.edu or phone 814-393-2109.

Job Description Join us on our exciting journey! IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward.

Description

As the only global provider of commercial solutions, IQVIA understands what it takes to deliver nationally and internationally. Our teams help biopharma get their medicines to the people who need them. We help customers gain insight and access to their markets and ultimately demonstrate their product’s value to payers, physicians and patients. A significant part of our business is acting as the biopharma’s sales force to physicians or providing nurses to educate patients or prescribers. With the right experience, you can help deliver medical breakthroughs in the real world.
 
Neuroscience Sales Specialist
 
Our customer, Janssen’s Neuroscience division offers medications for the treatment of schizophrenia and continues to develop products in mental health. The primary objective of the specialty representative is to meet established sales goals by delivering real value to our customers through differentiated products and services. The specialty representative will be supported in this initiative with tools and promotional resources designed to have local impact. The successful representative will demonstrate the ability to target and manage their territory strategically while operating within an assigned budget. They will also need to be a highly engaged, positive team player and show a high degree of customer focus. The customer base generally for this role would be inclusive of Health Care Professional and treatment team members in the private Psychiatry and Community Mental Health settings.
 
Neuroscience Sales Specialist Role:
Applies account management approach, consultative selling skills, and clinical expertise to enhance our business and build support for our portfolio of products.
Analyzes and applies qualitative and quantitative market data to assess business opportunities and priorities, including relevant impact of local, District, and Region health care quality, delivery and reimbursement trends.
Demonstrates business acumen and ability to understand and deliver current brand strategies across the schizophrenia and mood therapeutic areas.
Develops and applies knowledge of payer access and affordability landscape in the territory regarding the company’s products.
Performs business analytics to recognize customer opportunities, strengths, and trends, and to monitor the effectiveness of the business plan. Adjusts the plan to minimize the impact of competition and to maximize sales opportunities.
Works effectively and efficiently with multiple local internal business partners to align and execute on key business plan objectives.

job_description:
Job Description
START AND END DATES FOR THIS INTERNSHIP ARE DURING SUMMER 2019 (3 months)

At IBM we have an amazing opportunity to transform the world with cognitive technology. By using the vast amounts of information available today to identify new patterns and make new discoveries, we are helping cities become smarter, hospitals transform patient care, financial institutions minimize risk, and pharmaceuticals find cures for rare diseases. Join the forward-thinking teams at IBM solving some of the worlds most complex problems there is no better place to grow your career!

Data Scientist Interns extract knowledge or insights from structured or unstructured data. They draw upon the practice of data analysis, using predictive analytics, data mining, pattern recognition, data modeling, machine learning and various statistical methods in order to help solve large scale optimization problems and to understand the meaning behind vast data sets

Data Scientist Interns are in demand across IBM's growth areas. You'll be matched and deployed to a team in a strategic business, based on your offered location and fit. These are office-based positions in IBM locations including:

AZ - Phoenix
CA - Almaden, Costa Mesa, Emeryville, Foster City, Redwood City, San Francisco, San Jose
CO - Denver
GA - Atlanta
IL - Chicago
MA - Andover, Cambridge, Littleton
MI - Ann Arbor
MN - Rochester
NC - Raleigh-Durham
NY - New York City, North Castle, Poughkeepsie, Yorktown Heights
OH - Cleveland, Dublin, Hartland
OR - Hillsboro
PA - Blue Bell, Pittsburgh
TX - Austin, Dallas
VT - Essex Junction

Opportunities in these locations will vary based on business demand.

What Youll Do:
You will implement and validate predictive models, and create and maintain statistical models with a focus on big data.
Youll communicate with internal and external clients to understand business needs and provide analytical solutions.
You will use statistical concepts such as regression, time series, mixed model, Bayesian methods, clustering, etc., to analyze data and provide insights.
Youll work in an Agile, collaborative environment, partnering with other scientists, engineers, and database administrators of all backgrounds and disciplines to bring analytical rigor and statistical methods to the challenges of predicting behaviors.
Who You Are:
You are great at solving problems; debugging; troubleshooting; and designing & implementing solutions to complex technical issues.
You thrive on teamwork and have excellent verbal and written communication skills.
You have strong technical and analytical abilities, a knack for driving impact and growth, and some experience with programming/scripting in a language such as Java or Python.
You have a basic understanding of statistical programming in a language such as R, SAS, or Python.
Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Must have basic knowledge of statistical concepts such as regression, time series, mixed model, Bayesian methods, clustering, etc., to analyze data and provide insights.
Must be enrolled or accepted into an accredited post-bachelor degree program.
Preferred Tech and Prof Experience
Advanced knowledge of statistical concepts such as regression, time series, mixed model, Bayesian methods, clustering, etc., to analyze data and provide insights.
EO Statement
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Overview

Susquehanna International Group, LLP (SIG) is a sophisticated and influential trading firm, active on the world's major securities and derivatives exchanges. Our European headquarters is based in Dublin, where we employ over 500 people in Trading, Quantitative Research & Technology across a range of trading strategies, including Exchange Traded Funds, Commodities, Options, Fixed Income, Equity Derivatives and Convertible Bonds.

We offer fantastic internship opportunities in our Dublin office. The infrastructure area is responsible for researching, designing and implementing the full trading capability for the European office, using leading edge hardware and software technologies. A SIG Internship allows you to get involved with development teams that are competing at a world-class level in the financial sector.

At SIG we believe an internship is about gaining real life experience, so during your internship you will be given real work that will actually be expected to be deployed and used! You will work as part of an existing infrastructure team ( Systems, Network, Application support and platform Engineering) team which allows you real life experience with teams that are competing at a world-class level in the financial sector.

As part of your internship you will be guided and assisted by senior engineers and have the opportunity to work as part of the team with a focus on developing and rolling out tools to provide visibility on the workings of the production trading network.

What we're looking for

The candidate will work with the Infrastructure team with a focus on developing and rolling out tools to provide visibility on the workings of the production trading network.

The candidate will be guided and assisted by senior network and security engineers and have the opportunity to see applications go from initial specification to full production.

The candidate will be required to work with a minimal amount of supervisionYou will be studying towards a degree in a computer related discipline with some experience of:
A deep level of understanding of TCP/IP protocol suite.
Familiarity with networking technologies such as switching and routing.
A scripting language e.g. Perl, Python
Databases and a basic understanding of SQL
An understanding of Data Science and Analytics
Strong interpersonal and communication skills for interacting with traders and other members of the technology team.
Duration: 5 12 Months

Join us on our exciting journey!

IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. job_description:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.Job DescriptionSoftwareengineering and data science skills, combined with the demands of a highly-visible enterprise metadata repository, make this an exciting challenge for the right candidate.Are you passionate about digital media, entertainment, and software services? Do you likebigchallenges and working within ahighly-motivatedteam environment?As aMetadataEngineer inthe dx Data Experience team, you will design, develop and support metadata repositories using real-time distributed computing architectures.Our mission is to enable many diverse users with the tools and information to gather, organize, make sense of Comcast data, and make it universally accessible to empower, enable, and transform Comcast into an insight-driven organization. Thedxbig dataorganization is afast-moving team of world-class experts who are innovating in end-to-end data delivery. We are a team that thrives onbigchallenges, results, quality, and agility.Who does theMetadataengineer work with?DX MetadataEngineering is a diverse collection of professionals who work with a variety of teams ranging from: other software engineering teams whose Metadata repositories integrate with the Centralized Metadata Store, Portal engineers who develop a UI to support data discovery, software engineers on other DX platforms that ingest, transform, and retrieve data whose metadata is stored in the Centralized Metadata Store, data stewards/data architects who collect and disseminate metadata information,and users who rely on Metadata for data discovery and lineage. What are some interesting problems you'll be working on?You will design and develop the metadata and business glossary collection and enrich the system that allows real-time update of the enterprise and satellite metadata repositories using best-of-breed and industry-leading technologies. These repositories contain metadata and lineage for a widely diverse and ever-growing complement of datasets (e.g., Hortonworks, AWS S3, Streaming Data (Kafka/kinesis), streaming data transformation, ML pipeline, Teradata, and RDBMS's) You will design and develop cross-domain cross-platform lineage tooling by using advanced statistical methods and Machine Intelligence algorithms. You will develop tools to discover data across disparate metadata repositories, develop tools for data governance, and implement processes to rationalize data across the repositories.Where can you make an impact?The dx Teamis building the enterprise metadata repository needed to drive the next generation ofdata platforms and data processing capabilities.Building data applications, identifying trouble spots, and optimizing the overall user experience is a challenge that can only be met with a robustmetadata repository capable of providing insightsinto the data and its lineage.Success in this role is best enabled by a broad mix of skills and interests ranging from traditional distributed systems software engineering prowess to the multidisciplinary field of data science.Responsibilities:-Lead design and development of metadata assets, primarily using Java 8. Oversee the research, writing, and editing of documentation and technical requirements including software designs, evaluation plans, test results, technical manuals, and formal recommendations and reports.-Employ rigorous continuous delivery practices managed under an agile software development approach.-Assist with technical leadership throughout the design process and assist in guidance with regards to practices, procedures, and techniques.-Prototype ideas for new tools, and services. Job Description Join us on our exciting journey! IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward.

Description

Our customer, Janssen’s Neuroscience division offers medications for the treatment of schizophrenia and continues to develop products in mental health. The primary objective of the specialty representative is to meet established sales goals by delivering real value to our customers through differentiated products and services. The specialty representative will be supported in this initiative with tools and promotional resources designed to have local impact. The successful representative will demonstrate the ability to target and manage their territory strategically while operating within an assigned budget. They will also need to be a highly engaged, positive team player and show a high degree of customer focus. The customer base generally for this role would be inclusive of Health Care Professional and treatment team members in the private Psychiatry and Community Mental Health settings.
 
Neuroscience Sales Specialist Role:
Applies account management approach, consultative selling skills, and clinical expertise to enhance our business and build support for our portfolio of products.
Analyzes and applies qualitative and quantitative market data to assess business opportunities and priorities, including relevant impact of local, District, and Region health care quality, delivery and reimbursement trends.
Demonstrates business acumen and ability to understand and deliver current brand strategies across the schizophrenia and mood therapeutic areas.
Develops and applies knowledge of payer access and affordability landscape in the territory regarding the company’s products.
Performs business analytics to recognize customer opportunities, strengths, and trends, and to monitor the effectiveness of the business plan. Adjusts the plan to minimize the impact of competition and to maximize sales opportunities.
Works effectively and efficiently with multiple local internal business partners to align and execute on key business plan objectives.
IQVIA offers a friendly, progressive work atmosphere and a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, life insurance and vision coverage, tuition assistance, bonus plan and 401(k).

job_description:
Elsevier Precision Medicine (PMed) is developing the next generation of clinical decision support and research tools which will escalate the global state of personalized medicine use in healthcare. Together with our partners, we leverage big data, machine learning technology, analytics, and predictive approaches to help facilitate the creation of and deployment of knowledge for use by clinicians to improve diagnosis and treatment.

Key to this strategy is the need for a talented Senior Data Scientist. Reporting to the Senior Director, Software Engineering the successful individual will work in tandem with technology and research to create and advise on different data modeling techniques, deliver the modeling approach and enhance the team’s data modeling capabilities. They will also extract meaningful, contextualized data from Elsevier’s unrivalled long form content and combine it with patient data to provide actionable insight and guidance to healthcare decision makers.
You will bring engineering experience from building data driven products, creating predictive models and working on large scale content extraction.
Ideally you will also have healthcare domain experience and a PhD in a related field, for example Health Informatics or Predictive Algorithm Design. If you are also a qualified MD then that would be an added benefit.
You will serve as a strong mentor for others.
Hands on experience in product development and various engineering practices (such as Agile) would also be preferred.
This is an exciting career enhancing opportunity to be at the forefront of healthcare technology and its ability to impact the health of people worldwide.

Accolade
Dir, Actuarial
This Job is In
Plymouth Meeting, PA
Hide Job Details
This Company Works InHealthcare, Tech
Company Sizemedium
Company Description

Accolade at a glance…

Accolade is a personalized health and benefits solution that dramatically improves the experience, outcomes and cost of healthcare for employers, health plans and their members. With a unique blend of compassionate advisors, clinical experts and intelligent technologies, we engage individuals and families in their health, establish trust, and influence their decisions at every stage of care. Accolade connects the widest array of personal health data and programs to present a single point of contact to the most effective health and benefits resources, while coordinating with providers at every step. Accolade consistently achieves 70 and higher Net Promoter Scores, 98% consumer satisfaction ratings, and up to 15% employer cost savings. Accolade has been recognized as one of the nation’s 25 most promising companies by Forbes, a fastest-growing private healthcare company by Inc. 5000, and is consistently rated a Top Workplace across the country. For more information, visit accolade.com.

Job Description

Role overview

The Actuarial Director is responsible for being the Actuarial subject matter expert for a select group of customers within a Market Segment (i.e. Enterprise, Strategic, Mid-Market, Health Plan, etc.).

They will direct the reporting to these customers showcasing our value and outcomes and will communicate them to internal partners as well as customers.

They will identify, work and recommend areas for additional revenue generation with their internal partners.

This role will report to the Chief Actuary.

A day in the life…
Design and direct analytics & reports that produce key metrics, highlight areas where Accolade creates value and identify new opportunities for value creation.
Using influence skills, suggest opportunities for Accolade operations as well as customer to improve gaps. You will be the primary Accolade Actuarial resource for the customer(s) in communicating the value of Accolade services, as well as identifying potential future opportunities to further drive savings.
Identify customer themes, analyze data and make recommendations for future improvements.
Working with internal partners, develop complex, customized analysis for customers and communicate those findings both internally and externally. Using influence skills, gain customers agreement to pay for additional reporting therefore generating more revenue.
Work with Product Management teams to develop & outline the requirements for complex reporting needs, support the construction of reports and direct team to meet deliverables.
Supervise monthly production analysis of Accolade’s Savings results, including validating financial reconciliation, analyzing results for outlier patterns, and communicating summarized results to internal and external partners.
Calculate and analyze variances in the claims savings, based on each customer’s contractual performance guarantee requirements.
Supervise analysis of healthcare spend and utilization patterns to uncover drivers of results with large and small populations.
Supervise & lead the evaluation of the programs provided by Accolade’s partners for the impact they have on cost and utilization. This would include telemedicine, second opinion services, cost transparency, etc.
Create reportingand communicate results and identify areas for improvement

Qualifications

What we are looking for…
Bachelor’s Degree in a field such as: Actuarial Science, Risk Management, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics or related field.
Associate in Society of Actuaries required / Fellow in Society of Actuaries preferred.
10+ years of actuarial experience.
Excellent Excel, PowerPoint and SQL skills.
Excellent written and interpersonal communication skills.
Strong Management skills.
Consistently demonstrate ability to influence and negotiate with internal partners.
Ability to manage multiple projects, prioritize and direct team members as appropriate.
A leader who can influence others by the strength of personality, integrity, ability, sense of humor and interpersonal skills.
Strong technical skills with deep understanding of actuarial concepts, ability to train staff & facilitate application to work product.
Independent worker: courage, decision quality, listening, drive for results, customer and client focus, integrity and ability to deal with ambiguity.
The ability to lead, organize, manage and prioritize multiple projects at one time while balancing short term and longer term needs and helping to shape our future vision.
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Senior Web Application Software Engineer - Philadelphia
Philadelphia, PA

Job Description
Lutron Electronics Company

By 2020 experts predict up to 200 billion connected devices worldwide serving a community of smart homes and connected buildings. We at Lutron pride ourselves on contributing to the IoT market. Lutron has control solutions for a wide variety of lighting, energy savings, and shading needs, from a single room in a home to a multi-building campus.

Here at Lutron we have been at the forefront of IoT and technology innovation. We are looking for talented and motivated individuals who want their voice to be heard and their work to make a difference. Whether your interests are in user experience design, data science, machine learning, systems engineering, mobile development, or cloud services, Lutron has a career path to help you achieve your goals.

Why Lutron is a great place to be a software developer:
You’ll have the opportunity to take ownership of tasks and projects, contributing to solutions from up-front design through deployment and delivery.
There are a wide variety of new and established technologies to learn at Lutron. You can build iPhone apps, Cloud-based .Net web applications, or work with Go in our latest projects.
Lutron is an established global brand that continues to grow world-wide, so your contributions will reach commercial and end users in countries all across the globe.
We have a variety of paths and leadership opportunities that you can pursue to advance your career. In addition, you’ll be surrounded by other bright minds that will constantly challenge you to attain new heights.
Lutron is a privately held company that isn’t subject to the whims of the market. This gives us the freedom to pursue strategic, game-changing initiatives rather than chasing short term profits.
Your Contributions at Lutron:
Architect stable, efficient, and scalable software upon which world-class user interfaces can easily be built.
Design maintainable, elegant, and lasting solutions to meet a wide variety of requirements and feature sets while working closely with a team of other highly skilled engineering professionals to deliver top-quality software to the end user.
Balance a variety of tasks related to: requirements gathering, user interface design, protocol and communications architecture, database and object model design, software development, testing, trouble-shooting, and software maintenance.
Mentor and coach colleagues to expand the effectiveness of those around you.
Assure a high standard of quality in your own work and in the work of others on your team via good coding practices, process improvements, clean designs, smart testing and review practices.
What we’re looking for:
BS in Computer Science or similar, with at least a 3.0 GPA (or equivalent)
You have had at least 5 years experience developing software in a corporate or start-up environment.
Familiarity and hands-on experience with various design patterns
Excellent communication skills so that you can work collaboratively with other disciplines
Skillful at solving problems with enthusiasm and creativity
Willingness to travel 10% of the time, sometimes with little or no notice
Technical experience required in a majority of the following areas:
Object-oriented programming concepts (encapsulation, polymorphism, interfaces, etc.)
High-level programming languages such as C++, C#, Java, Objective C
Algorithm design and run-time analysis
Asynchronous programming techniques
Basic user-interface design
Web technologies (REST-based web services, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, etc.)
Database design (table design, stored procedure development)
Lutron Electronics’ position as the leading manufacturer of lighting controls worldwide, our unsurpassed quality, the breadth and depth of our product offerings, and our commitment to servicing our worldwide customers have resulted in double digit growth annually. This growth has in turn allowed the company to continue to invest in recruiting and retaining the best people we can find to service our customers. Continuous growth has also fueled our ability to constantly develop new technologies and new manufacturing processes that in turn drive the creation of new or better products and services.
Lutron offers a competitive compensation and benefits package and a dynamic and professional work environment. We also offer continued growth through increased job responsibilities, courses offered through Lutron University and advancement opportunities. For more information, view our website at www.lutron.com. EOE/AA

Description

Incumbent will create dashboard reports to inform senior leadership that includes safety/quality, research/scholarship, community service, retention/engagement/inclusion, education, and financial management. Incumbent will improve the selection of data points, the process of harvesting data, and help message data strengths and limitations. Future tasks may include co-leading and co-managing high level portions of strategic planning in the college of medicine, with an emphasis on data grounded, measurable outcomes. Typical Work Duties: Manage the design, collection, retrieval and analysis of critical forecasting and performance data. Prepare written and/or verbal presentations or proposals on highly complex issues and deliver to a broad variety of audiences. Incumbent will work independently on highly complex or strategic issues, which may involve unusual circumstances, or highly confidential or conflicting data. Other tasks as needed. Comfort working with leading executive administrators in a successful environment is essential. Typically requires a Master's degree or higher plus five years of related experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience. SPSS or SAS is essential. This is a fixed-term appointment funded for one year from date of hire.

Description

The Facilities Engineering Institute (PSFEI) of The Pennsylvania State University is seeking a data analyst to support PSFEI and its Commonwealth of PA (COPA) clients in extracting value from EnergyCAP (a utility bill management system) through written communications, training, and performing analysis of data from EnergyCAP and PSFEI’s web-based utility procurement platform. The analyst will be trained in the operation and maintenance of the EnergyCAP software and is expected to become an expert user. The successful candidate will work directly with PSFEI clients to assist them with using EnergyCAP to determine the proper analytical approach and method to improve understanding of energy use, identify energy saving opportunities and assess improvements, and validate energy measurement and verification analyses. Expert skills in Microsoft Excel are required, including the use of advanced analytical functions, pivot tables, PowerPivot, and the ability to work with connected databases. Experience creating and executing Microsoft SQL scripts, including the ability to provide quality assurance testing for internally developed software, is preferred. The candidate must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills including the ability to convey complex, technical concepts to non-technical persons. The successful candidate is expected to develop and maintain professional working relationships with PSFEI staff, external COPA government agency personnel, and utility suppliers. The analyst must be able to work independently and as a member of a collaborative energy team. Typically requires a Bachelor's degree or higher plus three years of related experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Limited travel throughout PA is required. This position requires that you operate a motor vehicle as a part of your job duties. A valid driver’s license and successful completion of a motor vehicle records check will be required in addition to standard background checks. This is a fixed-term appointment funded for one year from date of hire with an excellent possibility of refunding.

Description

The Data Analyst graduate assistant (GA) in Student Affairs Research and Assessment (SARA) assists with measuring the effectiveness of strategic initiatives within Student Affairs, such as cocurricular learning and student engagement. Projects vary from year to year and may include assisting with the assessment of Penn State SAFE and AWARE, the New Student Survey, the Student Experience Survey, and the Student Drinking Survey. General responsibilities include: collaborating with student affairs professionals to develop good assessment and planning practices, managing multiple datasets and projects simultaneously; assisting with design of assessment projects, assisting with implementation of data collection processes; cleaning/managing data files and conducting statistical analyses; proofreading and editing reports for statistical errors and inconsistencies. Qualified candidates must be current Penn State graduate students who are able to demonstrate the understanding of and proficiency in SPSS (or similar statistical software packages) and other data management programs (e.g., Microsoft Access and Excel), and knowledge of quantitative methods and analysis. Preference will be given to candidates who exhibit evidence of familiarity with: advanced quantitative methods/analysis; qualitative methods/analysis; student development and environment theories, the student affairs profession, and/or the Penn State Student Affairs division. Preference will be given to candidates who would be available for at least two years of employment. This is a 10-month position from August 2016 to May 2017 for 20 hours a week. In accordance with graduate school guidelines, the position includes a monthly stipend and a tuition fee waiver.
job_name: Data Analyst Graduate Assistant - Student Affairs Research and Assessment

job_description:
Since 1946, Highlights for Children has been providing Fun with a Purpose® to tens of millions of children. Highlights is dedicated to helping children grow in basic skills and knowledge, in creativeness, in the ability to think and reason, in sensitivity to others, in high ideals and worthy ways of living—for children are the world's most important people®.

Highlights currently has an opening for a Digital Asset Management Specialist. As one of today’s premier media brands for children, Highlights has a broad reach including domestic and international product mixes ranging from magazines, book clubs, trade books, digital content, and partnership agreements. The Publishing Services Department is at the heart of developing best practices for creating and distributing this content, then tracking its usage and rights availability across the Highlights Consumer Businesses.

The Digital Asset Management Specialist is responsible for the day-to-day operations of the Digital Asset Management system including troubleshooting, end-user training, and ongoing data manipulation and conversion of assets. This role also fulfills asset requests for content, including preparation and delivery of files. Additionally, this role assists with a number of DAM-related projects and initiatives.

Essential Functions:
Convert, manipulate, package, and prepare files for various formats for DAM and customer end-use. Requires familiarity with Adobe Creative Suite and Adobe Acrobat as well as a variety of other tools and plug-ins.
Coordinate file transfer and distribution of files (Box, FTP, e-mail, etc.) and communication with both internal and external customers.
Develop an overall understanding of the entire Digital Asset Management system. Develop understanding of existing data, search, and reporting capabilities.
Provide support for DAM-related projects and initiatives.
Perform general maintenance on all files, including conversion, extraction, and reformatting.
Ongoing daily management and maintenance of DAM system.
Create end-user training documents and system documentation.
Other:
Manage asset requests for total customer satisfaction, proper rights management, and usage tracking.
Continuously add to and improve existing metadata and tagging structures.
Work as a partner with end-users to help them develop processes within the DAM System.
Present trainings to individuals and groups in person and via remote sessions.
Import and organize assets and metadata not currently in the DAM system, including data manipulation, sorting, cleaning, and combining.
Skills:
1-3 years of experience working with a Digital Asset Management system.
Data management: export, import, combine data.
Excellent software skills with ability to learn our existing Digital Asset Management system.
Hands-on experience with Adobe Creative Suite, particularly with Acrobat, InDesign and Photoshop.
Knowledge of Microsoft Office, particularly with Excel for various data cleanup activities and reporting needs.
Ability to analyze and derive useful insights from large data sets.
Solid organizational skills with strong attention to detail.
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and excellent problem-solving skills.
Team player, with the desire to actively participate in the greater publishing process
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree
Strong interpersonal skills
Experience in Data Science a plus
Ability to relocate to northeastern Pennsylvania
Location: Honesdale, PA

Job Description
Join us on our exciting journey!

IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward.

The IQVIA Advanced Analytics team is one of the leading healthcare analytical teams in the world. Joining the AA team provides the opportunity to work with extremely complex data and methodologies in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment. We seek highly motivated people who truly want to make a difference in the life sciences industry. At IQVIA, we look for the very best people, and then give them meaningful work to do. We don’t simply think about careers, we think about contributions.

Those who choose to work with us are joining a recognized global leader — a company uniquely positioned to help clients make the most of market opportunities and respond to challenges that affect global healthcare. We’re committed to blending industry expertise and advanced technology to deliver the most accurate perspectives and in-depth analytics on healthcare dynamics.

Role Purpose:
Under guidance, provides support in applying statistical methodologies to assigned research projects.

Principal Accountabilities:
Provides statistical methodology support in the delivery of standard and custom studies.
Applies statistical design and methodology to meet client information needs, conducts statistical analyses to derive conclusions from the study and assists in preparing written summaries of study results.
Works as part of a team in preparing analysis plans and statistical reports and performs validation of statistical analysis. Works on projects of limited scope within defined procedures and practices.

Minimum Education, Experience & Specialized Knowledge Required:
Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent, in Statistics, Mathematics, or related field with up to two (2) years of experience in operations research, market research, or applied statistics.
Technical knowledge/skills include: regression analysis, sampling, and basic knowledge of SAS programming languages in both PC and mainframe environments.

Additional Requirements:
Ability to carry out moderate analysis and information gathering to resolve problems on non-routine matters.

IQVIA is an EEO Employer - Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled

We know that meaningful results require not only the right approach but also the right people. Regardless of your role, we invite you to reimagine healthcare with us. You will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve human health outcomes.

Whatever your career goals, we are here to ensure you get there!
We invite you to join IQVIA™.

Job Description
The IBM North America Global Markets team is seeking highly talented individuals to fill consultative, client-focused, technical roles.

At IBM, were motivated by more than just selling solutions. We want our clients to succeed. Our clients have the future in mind, and your job is to help them get there. As part of IBMs sales team, you will work with clients as they transform organizations and entire industries. As an IBMer, you will have access to the entire organization to develop creative ideas that help clients build the world they envision.

Our clients are game changers; join a company where you can do your best work!

Our Technical Solution Specialists are guided by IBM's purpose To Be Essential.

You will actively:
Engage clients to develop trust and credibility
Help clients grow their businesses by solving strategic and tactical business problems with IBMs proven cognitive and cloud technology solutions
Partner with clients and demonstrate your technical expertise to assist your sales counterparts and maintain client satisfaction
Deliver industry-centric technology solutions to clients of all sizes and markets
Work in a changing environment where no two days are ever the same
Work with the client account team and drive revenue through in-depth, complex technical demonstrations, designing solutions, technical evaluations, and/or proof-of-concepts
Be ready to interact with a variety of other smart and highly motivated people daily
Please note: this is not a coding, development or extensive hands-on role. This role will involve technical consulting with clients, helping them design technical solutions.

This position requires a challenger mentality; a real passion for client success, sales achievement, and daily collaboration with clients and other IBM teammates. You may work with any of the following business units: Analytics, Business Partners, Cloud, Internet of Things, Security, Services, Systems Hardware, Talent & Collaboration Solutions, Watson Customer Engagement.. You may work in one of the following markets: Communication, Distribution, Federal, Financial Services, Industrial or Public.

Summit Training

During the nine-month development program, we provide extraordinary technology, industry solution training, shadowing opportunities and consultative sales training through a combination of classroom and online resources, hands-on field experiences, and structured mentorship. We will equip you with the knowledge and skills needed to match the technical capabilities of IBM offerings to client requirements and help you grow as a leader.

We offer Summit opportunities in one of 7 metro regions: Atlanta GA, Boston MA, Chicago IL, Dallas TX, New York NY, San Francisco CA, and Washington DC.

Training requires 25% travel.

Be a Challenger. Step Up, Get Ready and Jump into the Ring!

This role may be for you if you show a proven track record of accomplishment in:
Aptitude to learn and use innovative selling technologies (e.g., analytics, social media) to network, engage clients, identify new business opportunities, and translate business requirements into technology solutions
Conversant and knowledgeable about technology, trends and how technology is being applied to address business challenges
Team collaboration and leadership
Experience demonstrating business insight for long-lasting client relationships and results
Motivation to accomplish sales and business objectives
Professional verbal, written, and interpersonal skills
Empathy and skills to achieve high levels of customer satisfaction
If you would like additional information about the Summit Program, please visit: http://www-03.ibm.com/employment/summit

IBM will not be providing visa sponsorship for these positions now or in the future. Therefore, in order to be considered for the IBM Summit program, you must have the ability to work without a need for current or future visa sponsorship.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Bachelor's or Masters Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Computer Engineering, Analytics, Electrical Engineering, Information Technology or similar disciplines
Preferred Tech and Prof Experience
Prior work experience in client sales or service
Programming coursework or experience
EO Statement
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Job Description Join us on our exciting journey! IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward.

Description

The Director IT Procurement is responsible for purchasing of software and/or hardware at optimal pricing, spend analytics, developing and implementing enterprise-wide sourcing strategies, policies and processes of IT commodities. We are looking for a Director level professional to lead all aspects of strategic sourcing from supplier selection to enterprise wide negotiations of IT commodities, conducting supplier management activities and manage a team for tactical execution of the end-to-end procurement process. Maintaining an up-to-date understanding of enterprise needs, relevant industries and best practices for strategic sourcing is crucial.


Responsibilities

•Develop, lead and execute IT procurement strategies
•Perform strategic sourcing and spend analytics for IT Commodities to reduce costs
•Perform market research on assigned IT categories and IT commodities
•Identify qualified IT suppliers for participation in sourcing events
•Lead contract negotiations using a variety of techniques, including multi-round competitive bidding, RFx processes
•Manage and facilitate cross-functional teams in the pursuit of several IT procurement categories
•Maintain the highest degree of ethical standards and adherence to procurement policies
•Monitor significant developments among IT suppliers, including financial results, management turnover and product line strategies
•Provide training and tools to business users and internal customers to support these procurement processes
•Provide management and administrative support for technology tools that support the supplier and contract management processes
•Network externally to facilitate competitive intelligence, including best practices, emerging/potential sources of competitive advantage, market pricing, etc.
•Work with internal customers and business units to formulate short to long-term IT sourcing strategies for external suppliers/service providers
•Develop effective working relationships with key decision makers/influencers; line of business executives, and subject matter experts
•Monitor supplier compliance with established agreements. This includes monitoring service levels, outages or other unusual events, customer satisfaction levels and supplier responsiveness. Also includes reviewing the accuracy and timeliness of invoices and payment
•Monitor compliance with established agreements. This includes adherence to contracts terms, meeting requirements for self-audit and true-ups
•Track and report savings for assigned categories
•Analyze procurement processes for inefficiencies
•Analyze procurement policies for gaps and ineffectiveness
•Make recommendations regarding opportunities for improvement
•Lead, partner, or consult on implementing sanctioned changes
•Take advantage of opportunities to increase utilization of enterprise wide agreements including demand management
•Manage transactional team to execute and track negotiated contracts throughout the lifecycle of the IT commodity
•Prioritize own work activities based on input from internal customers and IT Procurement management
•Communicate regularly with the head of IT Procurement to provide progress, savings updates and coordinate initiatives
•Report to the head of IT Procurement

Job Requirements Requirements


BS degree/certification in Supply Chain Management

Professional background in purchasing and procurement of IT goods and services

5+ years of work experience with at least 3 years managing a team

Understanding of principles of accounting including the ability to read and analyze financial statements of suppliers

Superior interpersonal, communication and conflict resolution skills

Highly developed analytical and critical thinking skills

Demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally and manage teams

Excellent leadership presentation and influencing skills at both executive and peer level

Desire to succeed in a data-driven, fast changing and dynamic environment




IQVIA is an EEO Employer - Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled

Join us on our exciting journey!

IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward.

The Analytics Center of Excellence

Our new Analytics Center of Excellence (ACOE) harnesses our global healthcare insights, working closely with our clinical and therapeutic experts to power evidence-driven design, speed site activation and recruit the right patients, faster. This is a new unit within our business, integrated within Clinical Operations. We’re using big data and advanced analytics to derive insights that transform clinical development and bring new medicines to patients faster through successful trial delivery. This multi-functional team is an innovation for our business, requiring entrepreneurial and independent thinking to build our capability. Unique and with a global view, this Center of Excellence is a chance to revolutionize the clinical research industry.

Manager, Product Development - the role

In this role, you will be acting as a Product Manager for Offerings development. You will own the strategy, vision and roadmap for critical data science product offerings, serving as the primary champion for your product offering(s). You will work with business stakeholders to help define each product offering, capturing key operational needs and success measures for the development efforts. In addition to working closely with business stakeholders, you will collaborate with the ACOE development team, ensuring that the business requirements are appropriately translated and detailed into actionable stories within the product backlog. You will serve as a subject matter expert for the development team regarding key goals, and act as the primary liaison to the business, ensuring ongoing visibility to development progress.

Your typical activities might include:

· Defining the vision and success measures for prioritized product offering(s), in collaboration with business stakeholders

· Gathering and supporting prioritization of product requirements, providing recommendations, as appropriate

· Developing and managing project roadmaps for product offering(s), integrating the product strategy, inclusive of timelines, risks, and dependencies

· Driving product development by coordinating with global analytics team members developing offering

· Proactively identifying and addressing issues for development team, in order to avoid delays

· Support product offering documentation requirements, including formal communication and presentations for business stakeholders and executive leadership

· Offering mentoring and coaching in a quickly growing team that is key to delivering differentiating solutions for IQVIA

Qualifications:

Our ideal candidate will have:

· Strong communication, presentation and interpersonal skills, including good command of the English language

· Strong analytical, organizational and problem solving skills

· Demonstrated ability to deliver results to the appropriate quality and timeline metrics

· Demonstrated team leadership and mentoring skills

· Excellent customer service skills

· Good judgment and ability to manage competing priorities

· Strong software and computer skills, including MS Office applications

· Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with coworkers, managers and business stakeholders

· High-level understanding of data science and machine learning concepts, with the ability to convey to non-technical audiences

· Understanding of the fundamentals of software development processes and procedures, including agile approach

MINIMUM REQUIRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

· Bachelor's degree with 5 years’ clinical research experience including 3 years’ product/project management experience; or equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

We know that meaningful results require not only the right approach but also the right people. Regardless of your role, we invite you to reimagine healthcare with us. You will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward. Whatever your career goals, we are here to ensure you get there! We invite you to join IQVIA™.
