Job description


ANALYTICS, GO-TO-MARKET, INDUSTRY VALUE TEAM - SENIOR MANAGER


The digital revolution is changing everything. It’s everywhere – transforming how we work and play. Accenture Digital’s 36,000 professionals are driving these exciting changes and bringing them to life across 40 industries in more than 120 countries. At the forefront of digital, you’ll create it, own it and make it a reality for clients looking to better serve their connected customers and operate always-on enterprises. Join us and become an integral part of our experienced digital team with the credibility, expertise and insight clients depend on.

Accenture Analytics, part of Accenture Digital, helps clients to use analytics and artificial intelligence to drive actionable insights, at scale. We apply sophisticated algorithms, data engineering and visualization to extract business insights and help clients turn those insights into actions that drive tangible outcomes—to improve their performance and disrupt their markets. Accenture Analytics is a leader in Analytics, with deep industry and technical experience. We provide services and solutions that include Analytics Advisory, Data Science, Data Engineering and Analytics-as-a-Service.

ROLE DESCRIPTION: ANALYTICS, PRODUCTS INDUSTRY VALUE TEAM - SENIOR MANAGER

Analytics Industry Value Teams are an integral part of Accenture’s Analytics practice, partnering with our largest clients to define and enable insights-led transformation. As a Senior Manager in our practice you will help shape and sell industry specific programs, including definition of the analytics vision & strategies, redefine the operating model & talent strategy, and manage the change journey to deliver sustainable business value. You will act as the architect for our most transformative opportunities, enabling an end-to-end analytics journey by bringing the best of our Accenture Analytics organization. You will also play a key role on the leadership team – building a practice, assets, and thought leadership.

RESPONSIBILITIES:


1. Support Go To Market activities for the industry value team for the Products industries.
Work with operations and industry value teams (IVT) to schedule and define immersion sessions
Work with Operating Unit (OU) Analytics leads to define deal shape for core IVT offering
Work with OU lead to manage pipeline
2. Sales Origination & Business Development
Educate internal Accenture stakeholders about the IVT Team and offerings
Facilitate the development of “request for proposals” responses and contract development
Lead the development of businesses cases for further project sales as determined by the practice
3. Practice & Offering Management
Shape IVT assets to accelerate sales and delivery
Drive the analytics innovation agenda, including publishable thought leadership
Play an active role building a practice including capability development and recruiting
Identify and help bring into the practice talented individuals both internally from Accenture as well as externally
REQUIRED SKILLS:

General management consulting skills
Demonstrated ability to lead complex programs
Develop deep understanding of IVT offerings
Commercial deal shaping
Client Delivery & Relationship Management
Ability to interact with and influence Manager/ Director/VP
Ability to interpret the results of analytical insights and translate results to the client in business context to drive value
Able to explain complex concepts in non-technical language
Strong story-telling ability

+ Basic qualifications
YOUR EXPERIENCE: Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree
Minimum of 5-7 years of consulting experience with proven track record of making significant client impact and value creation
Minimum of 10 years of experience in designing and utilizing analytic solutions in enterprise-wide organizations with a specialty in marketing, sales, and service domains
Superior understanding of how to manage client relationship, deliver analytics value, and influence senior clients to define and expand data-driven strategies into new applications and markets
Masters level degree in a quantitative field such as statistics, econometrics in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Marketing, or Operations Analysis, PhD is a plus
Minimum of 5 years of program mgmt. and business transformation
Meet travel requirements, up to 50%
SET YOURSELF APART: Preferred Skills:

Exceptional presentation skills – ability to convey technology and business value propositions
Strong Data Management Technology background
Value based constructs
5 years of experience interacting with clients of all levels to review expected outputs, applicability to business challenges, and model measurement
Well connected with cutting-edge analytics techniques and be confident about how to apply them to generate insights and recommendations
3 years of experience guiding the data formulation process and exploratory data analysis
5 years of experience guiding and managing a team of practitioners to execute analytics solutions, both onshore and offshore
Proven ability to manage multiple simultaneous work streams and shift / adjust resources to achieve optimal results
Evidence of thought leadership in defining innovative analytics within multiple complex applications spanning marketing, risk, and cost reduction
Excellent communication skills to drive thought-provoking dialogs with senior clients
Professional Skill Requirements
Proven ability to build, manage and foster a team-oriented environment
Proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment
Desire to work in an information systems environment
Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills
Excellent leadership and management skills
OUR COMMITMENT TO YOU
Your entrepreneurial spirit and vision will be rewarded, and your success will fuel opportunities for career advancement.
You will make a difference for some pretty impressive clients. Accenture serves 94 of the Fortune Global 100 and more than 80 percent of the Fortune Global 500.
You will be an integral part of a market-leading analytics organization, including the largest and most diversified group of digital, technology, business process and outsourcing professionals in the world. You can leverage our global team to support analytics innovation workshops, rapid capability development, enablement and managed services.
You will have access to Accenture’s deep industry and functional expertise. We operate across more than 40 industries and have hundreds of offerings addressing key business and technology issues. Through our global network, we bring unparalleled experience and comprehensive capabilities across industries and business functions, and extensive research on the world’s most successful companies. You will also be able to tap into the continuous innovation of our Accenture Technology Labs and Innovation Centers, as well as top universities such as MIT through our academic alliance program.
You will have access to distinctive analytics assets that we use to accelerate delivering value to our clients including more than 550 analytics assets underpinned by a strong information management and BI technology foundation. Accenture has earned more than 475 patents and patents pending globally for software assets, data- and analytic-related methodologies and content.
As the world’s largest independent technology services provider, we are agnostic about technology but have very clear viewpoints about what is most appropriate for a client’s particular challenge. You will have access to our alliances with market-leading technology providers and collaborative relationships with emerging players in the analytics and big data space—the widest ecosystem in the industry. These alliances bring together Accenture’s extensive analytics capabilities and alliance providers’ technology, experience and innovation to power analytics-based solutions.
You will have access to the best talent. Accenture has a team of more than 36,000 digital professionals including technical architects, big data engineers, data scientists and business analysts, as well as user digital strategists and experience designers.
Along with a competitive salary, Accenture offers a comprehensive package that includes generous paid time off, 401K match and an employee healthcare plan. Learn more about our extensive rewards and benefits here: Benefits.
CALL TO ACTION

Now is the time to become a digital disrupter. The opportunity is here—what’s stopping you from pursuing it?

Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).

Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.

Accenture is an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

Equal Employment Opportunity

All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.

Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.

job_description:
Your Responsibilities:

Job Purpose*

To provide a leadership role in the global Bioimaging team to deliver optimised imaging data management and advanced computational approaches for data analytics, visualization and modelling. The role requires experience in the modelling/analysis of imaging data and will require the development of numerous analytics strategies to work with and align the varied range of highly complex, multidimensional, multimodel imaging data acquired by the global Bioimaging platform. The role includes working with various GSK platform and discovery teams to directly answer project challenges in drug discovery or to operate as part of a matrix of data scientists linking available resources to provide more powerful decision-making tools to address such challenges. The role will also involve working across other GSK Imaging teams to establish an analytics translation between imaging data both high-content cellular screening and clinical/experimental imaging studies.

Key Responsibilities (10 bullet points maximum)

Describe the key deliverables to be achieved by the post holder and the ongoing responsibilities of the role

Responsible for:

• the development and qualification of novel imaging analytics capabilities within GSK to support understanding of drug Biodistribution and the definition of phenotypic traits/functional alterations to biology in cells, tissues, preclinical models and clinical subjects

• the development and delivery of external collaborations to meet the need for efficient and informative methods for imaging data processing and modelling

• delivering direct and indirect data management/imaging analytics support for GSK project/programs and communication of findings to deep therapeutic experts in these areas

• the management of all imaging data obtained within the global Bioimaging platform including working with R&D Data and R&D Tech colleagues to align imaging data to the wider enterprise resources

• direct and matrix leadership for provision of analytics approaches to maximising the primary use and availability for secondary reuse of imaging data

• engaging with imaging scientists to implement new data driven approaches to imaging data acquisition to enhance data quality and/or business efficiency.

Why You?

Basic qualifications:

A minimum of 5 years’ experience in imaging analytics as applied to complex imaging data for biological analyses.

Required degrees: Masters

Preferred qualifications:

Programming experience/skills in using MatLab, R or high-level computer language (C++)

Experience with machine learning approaches or Deep Learning

Experience with modelling of imaging data from medical or biological imaging studies.

Description:Are you looking for an exciting career as a Software Engineer at one of the top Aerospace and Defense Companies? A fulfilling position that challenges your mind, grows your skills, and contributes to our Nations most critical missions is right in front of you. At Lockheed Martin Space, we advance the frontiers of science, help militaries protect what matters most, and solve problems that others think are impossible. Come join us for challenging missions that will inspire and innovate!

Our Deer Creek facility in Colorado is one of a kind. Amazing views of red rocks that will take your breath away and a koi pond to relax next to. This site offers numerous amenities such as a fitness center, cafeteria, rooftop parking, and numerous meeting and breakout rooms. In addition, employees enjoy great benefits such as health, vision, dental, 401K, paid time off, and flexible work schedules.

This position provides you the opportunity to gain valuable skills regarding data science, machine learning, and cloud processing via two analytics projects.

Your role in one project is to develop and implement new analytic algorithms and capabilities for a group of ISR problems using particular data, and also to participate in the design and running of experiments to assess the developed algorithms and capabilities. The algorithms are relatively simple and the focus is on getting them to work on real-world problems and data. The system runs in the cloud using Apache Spark. Your role is the day-to-day algorithm development person in a small project team, working with a software developer and with advice from a senior algorithm person in the team. The other project is either a related internal R&D (IRAD) project or on another R&D contract activity; the choice depends somewhat on timing.

Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.
Basic Qualifications:
Must have some relevant background that supports an ability to work on algorithm implementation and performing experiments, such as some prior experience or else basic math skills.

Full-time programmer skills; software design/code/debug/deliver

Active Top Secret clearance with the ability to obtain a TS/SCI
Desired Skills:
Ability to work in a small project team and on the diversity of functionality needed in a research project's test bed.

Master's degree in computer science, engineering, physics, math, or related discipline; or Bachelor's degree in one of these areas with relevant experience.

Some familiarity with the ISR problem domain.

Software Skills: Cloud processing (especially Apache Spark and ElasticSearch), Python, Linux OS.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
Must have some relevant background that supports an ability to work on algorithm implementation and performing experiments, such as some prior experience or else basic math skills.

Full-time programmer skills; software design/code/debug/deliver

Active Top Secret clearance with the ability to obtain a TS/SCI

As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martins vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.

Join us at Lockheed Martin, where were engineering a better tomorrow.

Overview: Management Science Associates, Inc. (MSA) is a diversified information management company that for half a century has provided market leaders with a competitive edge in data management, analytics, and technology. We are currently seeking a highly motivated Associate Business Analytics Manager for our Business Analysis division. A core requirement for the position is the ability to develop detailed analytical models and subsequently translate the model results into business implications. Statistical packages such as SAS and R are utilized for data processing, manipulation, and integration as well as for model development. Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint are used extensively to convey analytical results. Frequent client interaction, both written and verbal, will be required; therefore strong communication skills and the ability to build client relationships are a must. Clients span a range of industries including fast moving consumer goods, health and beauty, and pharmaceuticals.

Responsibilities:
Use advanced statistical techniques such as predictive modeling, latent variable modeling, partitioning methods, bootstrapping, etc. to resolve complex client issues. Create and maintain client models, forecasts and reporting. Lead and participate in client interactions.
Conduct independent and collaborative analytical work on client projects led by higher-level team members
Develop and maintain efficient analytical code and documentation to manipulate large datasets and conduct statistical analysis
Test and debug analytical code. Lead efforts to resolve unexpected problems resulting from unusual data and from limitations inherent in software applications and data processing resources.
Interpret and translate analytical results into business implications that resonate with clients using a variety of techniques ranging from simple data aggregation to complex data mining and modeling, with minimal guidance from higher-level division members
Oversee data analytics for small projects or portions of a larger project and manage client relationships for assigned projects. Actively participate in client presentations
Develop in-depth understanding of client's product and marketing environment. Identify solutions to client problems
Mentor, train and guide lower level staff
May lead teams and assist with management responsibilities of lower level staff including, but not limited to, performance management and salary administration. May provide direct management of one or more interns.
Assist division management in sales efforts, such as preparing materials and performing research, and in writing client proposals
Required Skills
Bachelor's degree in Quantitative Analytics, Business Analytics, Math, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science or related discipline, or equivalent experience. MBA or relevant Master's degree may substitute for up to one year of related experience. PhD may substitute for up to 5 years of experience depending on discipline.
Minimum five years of related experience performing analytical problem solving within market research, data analytics, computer science, or related field
Knowledge of statistics, mathematics, marketing principles and current business trends
Strong analytical, critical thinking, problem solving, and data management skills. Proficient with statistical methods, models, and analytics.
Knowledgeable of different quantitative research techniques to be applied to client issues
Organized with effective time management skills and the ability to multi-task and meet deadlines
Highly detail-oriented, with an eye for quality standards
Innovative and proactive in solving client problems and identifying process improvements
Strong communication skills, both written and oral, coupled with highly developed interpersonal skills to effectively communicate with clients in a professional manner
Advanced Microsoft office skills including MS Word, MS Excel, and MS PowerPoint, MS Explorer and MS Outlook calendar and email
Advanced knowledge of analytical programming and statistical packages
Problem solving skills with the ability to maintain an open mind and think creatively about problems and their resolution
Strong work ethic and commitment to getting the job done
Self-motivated for continued learning and growth
High degree of flexibility
Accepting of change and uncertainty
Ability to form, maintain, and manage client relationships
Ability to be innovative and proactive in solving client problems and identifying process improvements
Ability to inspire team members to reach their full potential
Required Experience

Job Description
Companies that embrace open source development and differentiate well will lead, and those who do not will fall behind. Be a part of a team of developer advocates who help developers and data scientists discover and successfully utilize open source data and AI technologies, as well as related IBM offerings. Your work will include a combination of contributing to open source technologies, publication of high-quality technical content, and direct engagement with developers and data scientists at events.

The team engages directly in open source community advocacy projects relevant to a wide array of IBM offerings and industries around the globe, and internally to IBM's transformation to a data-driven cognitive enterprise. The team of open source developer advocates works with other IBMers, IBM Research, and open source community members on high-quality content and events, and shares their content and code on GitHub and on IBM Code. The team engages the broader development community, and enables IBM offering managers to solve problems in health care, education, banking, insurance, manufacturing, oil & gas and automotive & robotics industries, to name a few.

From open source databases, to deep learning, to artificial intelligence, you will have an opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies for developers and data scientists. Some of the open source data and AI technologies underpinning our developer advocacy work include MongoDB, Redis, PostgreSQL, MySQL, Elasticsearch, ScyllaDB, JanusGraph, RabbitMQ, etcd, RethinkDB, Apache CouchDB, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, Jupyter, Apache Spark, and PixieDust. We leverage a number of languages and runtimes including Python, Java, Scala, Node.js/JavaScript, and R.

We are seeking an experienced developer advocate, open source contributor, software engineer, or data scientist with excellent communication skills to join our geographically distributed team. Ability to collaborate on a multi-functional team and across organizational boundaries is key. Empathy for the needs of developers, data scientists, and your fellow team members is a must. Experience with open source data and AI technologies, along with related IBM offerings is desirable. Experience with technical writing, blogging, building demo apps, presenting at conferences/Meetups, or comparable experience is a must. Experience with Python, Java, Scala, Node.js/JavaScript, or R is a must (or demonstrability capability to quickly learn one or more of these). Team leadership or project leadership experience is desirable. Community building or content editing experience is desirable.

Key Responsibilities:

Advocate for and empathize with the needs of developers and data scientists utilizing open source technologies and related IBM offerings

Write, publish, and publicize high-quality code and content targeting strategic open source communities

Democratize and improve access to and the utility of tools used by developers and data scientists through the creation and improvement of open technologies and supporting resources

Improve the productivity of developers, data scientists, and domain experts by expanding the usage of open source data and AI technologies within industries

Proactively communicate with a geographically distributed team utilizing email, Slack, GitHub, and other tools available to you

Maintain and build eminence within strategically important open source communities through your developer advocacy work

Collaborate with offering managers and product teams on offerings for developers and data scientists

Guide and mentor developers and data scientists to become self-sufficient open source developers

Be authentic; mentor others, and be open to mentoring by others (lifelong learner)

Read and comment on more code than you write; fix bugs, test cases, and documentation

While working across a range of open source communities and interacting with organizations such as the Linux Foundation and Apache Foundation, you will also get to travel the world for speaking engagements, as well as sharing knowledge embodied within IBM Code Patterns with open source developers.

As a member of the team you will have a T-shaped skill set, having a broad communications skills and deep developer advocacy, open source, software engineering, or data science skills.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
At least 5 years with one of - Software Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science, Developer Advocacy, or Related Field
At least 3 years with one of Technical Writing, Blogging, Demo Apps, Presenting at Conferences/Meetups, or Comparable Experience
At least 3 years with one of Python, Java, Scala, Node.js/JavaScript, or R (or demonstrable capability to quickly learn one or more of these languages/runtimes)
Preferred Tech and Prof Experience
At least 2 years with one of - MongoDB, Redis, PostgreSQL, MySQL, Elasticsearch, ScyllaDB, JanusGraph, RabbitMQ, etcd, RethinkDB, or Apache CouchDB
At least 2 years with one of - TensorFlow, Keras, or PyTorch
At least 1 year - Working Remotely on a Geographically Distributed Team
Bonus Technical and Professional Experience
At least 1 year with one of - Team Leadership or Project Leadership
At least 1 year with one of - Jupyter, Apache Spark, PMML/PFA, or PixieDust
At least 1 year with one of - Community Builder, Content Editor, or Open Source Contributor
At least 1 year with one of - IBM Cloud, Watson Studio, Watson Machine Learning, IBM Analytics, IBM Hybrid Cloud, IBM SPSS, PowerAI, Cloudant, or Compose
EO Statement
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

JOB SUMMARY

This job designs and engineers solutions associated with analytic data for the organization and, working closely with the business, analytic and IT teams, assists with the build and upkeep for these solutions. This includes coding data ingestion, transformation, and delivery programs/locic for analysts to access operational, derived, and external data sets. Expected deliverables will include; coding of delivery frameworks to load and transform raw source data into enhanced analytic assets, being a key resource for analytical and big data efforts, working with architects, analysts and data scientists as needed. The incumbent is responsible for the operation and execution of projects related to Big Data or other analytic platforms. Leverages experience in analyzing and delivering large data sets by using a variety of delivery tools to perform tasks. Works in cross-functional teams from different organizations (both technical and non-technical) on projects. Provides guidance and education to Intermediate and Junior level staff. Responsible for maintaining customer relationships. Technologies such as, but not limited to: Hadoop, Hive, NoSQL, Spark, Python, SAS, Teradata, Oracle, Informatica.

Work with data science teams and strategic partners on capabilities of core platform. This may include products purchased by the organization that must be ingested or modeled/derived data maintained by analytic teams.
Develop tasks across multiple projects with limited need for guidance. This includes providing guidance and education to Intermediate and Junior contributors within team. Manage relationships with customers of the function. Attend meetings with customers on a stand-alone basis or with team as needed.
Establish standards and patters for high performance data ingestion, transformation, and delivery of data analytic needs. Keep current with Big Data technologies in order to recommend best tools in order to perform current and future work

Do you want to build a cutting-edge search & discovery platform using the latest machine learning, deep learning and advanced information retrieval techniques? Do you want to apply data science principals to extract knowledge from the world’s largest medical and scientific knowledge base? Do you want to build the future of healthcare technology? If the answer is yes, then Elsevier is the place for you.

We are looking for a very talented computer scientist with strong algorithm design, problem solving, and engineering skills to join the Elsevier search & discovery team. The candidate must demonstrate a track record of writing top-class code to build scalable, high-performing software systems. And, demonstrate an ability to succeed in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

About Elsevier: the company is a world-leading provider of information solutions that help you make better decisions, deliver better care, and make groundbreaking discoveries in science, health, and technology.

Key Accountabilities:
Algorithm design and optimization.
Design and implement key components of the search and discovery platform.
Write top-class code that passes rigorous peer review.
Design and implement unit tests, functional tests, and regression tests to validate software functionality.
Complete complex bug fixes.
Keep abreast of new technology developments; apply those techniques for enhancing the system.
Applying machine learning (incl. deep learning) to identify patterns in data.
Interface with the product owner(s) and other technical personnel to groom and finalize requirements.
Continually explore methods to enhance code quality and system quality (e.g. automation)
Experience & Qualifications:
Expertise in building scalable and high-quality software using Java, Scala, Python or C#/C++.
Experience implementing search solutions with technologies such as SOLR, Elasticsearch, Lucene.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Advanced algorithm design and optimization skills.
Expertise in data structures and practical application of data structures.
Expert coding skills including demonstrated rigor in maintaining high code quality.
Demonstrated ability to unit, functional and regression test code to meet high code standards.
Expertise in performance tuning and scaling a software system.
Practical knowledge of search engine and recommendation systems.
Practical knowledge and application of machine learning and deep learning techniques.
Practical knowledge of source control and collaborative tools such as Git.
Demonstrated ability to be adaptable and successful in a fast-paced environment.
Experience building enterprise applications on a cloud service such as AWS or Azure is desirable.
Elsevier is a global information analytics business that helps institutions and professionals progress science, advance healthcare and improve performance for the benefit of humanity. We help researchers make new discoveries, collaborate with their colleagues, and give them the knowledge they need to find funding. We help governments and universities evaluate and improve their research strategies. We help doctors save lives, providing insight for physicians to find the right clinical answers, and we support nurses and other healthcare professionals throughout their careers. Elsevier provides digital solutions and tools in the areas of strategic research management, R&D performance, clinical decision support, and professional education; including ScienceDirect, Scopus, SciVal, ClinicalKey and Sherpath. Elsevier publishes over 2,500 digitized journals, including The Lancet and Cell, more than 35,000 e-book titles and many iconic reference works, including Gray's Anatomy.

Elsevier is part of RELX Group, a global provider of information and analytics for professionals and business customers across industries. Elsevier employs over 7,000 people in more than 70 offices worldwide. We are an employer of choice, attracting and developing talented and creative people who thrive in a challenging and fast-paced environment. We offer an excellent compensation and benefits package as well as a real opportunity for career growth in a growing organization. Elsevier is an equal opportunity employer: qualified applicants are considered for and treated during employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, protected veteran status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. If a qualified individual with a disability or disabled veteran needs a reasonable accommodation to use or access our online system, that individual should please contact 1.877.734.1938 or accommodations@relx.com.

We have an overarching objective to gather, organize, and make sense of Comcast data with the intention to reveal business and operational insight, discover actionable intelligence, enable experimentation, empower users, and delight our stakeholders. Members of the dx team define and leverage industry best practices, work on extremely large-scale data problems, design and develop resilient and highly robust distributed data organizing and processing systems and pipelines as well as research, engineer, and apply data science and machine intelligence disciplines.Our mission is to enable many diverse users with the tools and information to gather, organize, make sense of Comcast data, and make it universally accessible to empower, enable, and transform Comcast into an insight-driven organization.
Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

Elsevier is a world-leading provider of information&analytics solutions. Our talented team of engineers' fuse world class technology and content, overlay with big data tech, machine learning and cutting-edge technologies and empower clinicians, physicians and healthcare professionals with products that empower them to make better decisions, deliver better care, and sometimes make ground-breaking discoveries that advance the boundaries of knowledge and human progress. This role sits on our Via Oncology team.

Via is a national network of cancer centers working collaboratively to define pathways for virtually every aspect of cancer care, implement these best practices into daily patient care through decision support tools, and continuously measure and improve outcomes.

Via Pathways is currently seeking a UX Lead to help design the future of our clinical pathways products. Via Pathways is focused on helping healthcare professionals improve clinical outcomes through evidence-based care at every stage in the patient journey. As a UX Lead, you'll partner with Product Owners and Technology Leads to provide hands-on leadership in the user research, discovery, and evolution of the user experience of existing clinical pathways products and the design and elaboration of new product concepts.

UX Leads are hands-on player/coaches who will apply their deep experience to design user-centered solutions and directly manage a small team UX Designers, providing guidance and growth opportunities for direct reports.

A UX Lead in the Via Pathways group is expected to be an exemplar of our core UX values:
Collaboration: We solve problems best as a team.
Communication: We clearly communicate our role and processes to ensure all team members are aligned and working toward the same goals.
Champion: We believe that a relentless focus on our users, their problems and challenges, will maximize business value. We are user champions.
Your key responsibilities will include:

Deep User Focus
Develop a deep understanding of users' challenges and pain points through frequent contact.
Advocate for users' needs with the cross functional team and inspire the team to want to know more about their users and their unmet needs.
Use lean processes that effectively discover user needs and lead to product design concepts.
Balanced with Business Understanding
Collect feedback and insight from customers and business stakeholders to understand the business problem(s).
Validate we are addressing the right problem(s).
Partner with Product Owners to ensure we are designing viable products.
Informed by Data
Utilize data from analytics packages, customer insights, and other sources to determine context of research work.
Proactively use data to establish key metrics for projects and to inform testing strategies.
Ensure work is tested with users and business partners are actively engaged throughout the process.
Focused on Outcomes
Show mastery of Lean, User-Centered design processes.
Define the overall user experience of a product or products that are usable, accessible, effective, and delightful.
Create and manage delivery of solutions that clearly communicate the design direction and deliver exceptional user outcomes.
To Creatively Solve Problems
Consider the problem from all angles.
Collaborate with business partners, take on board, and recognize, others' ideas.
Iterate and test solution(s), that balance user needs and business goals, to validate that they solve the identified problem.
We are looking for exceptionally smart people who love working in a relaxed but highly motivated team culture, and who are eager to apply innovative technology to solve real problems today. We offer an exciting startup environment in a smaller team setting, including the ability to work remotely two days per week after an orientation period. Our open, collaborative culture, social activities - from foosball to bowling to volunteering with local charities - and great benefits are only a few of the reasons our team loves working at Via.

Elsevier is a global information analytics business that helps institutions and professionals progress science, advance healthcare and improve performance for the benefit of humanity. We help researchers make new discoveries, collaborate with their colleagues, and give them the knowledge they need to find funding. We help governments and universities evaluate and improve their research strategies. We help doctors save lives, providing insight for physicians to find the right clinical answers, and we support nurses and other healthcare professionals throughout their careers.

Elsevier provides digital solutions and tools in the areas of strategic research management, R&D performance, clinical decision support, and professional education; including ScienceDirect, Scopus, SciVal, ClinicalKey and Sherpath. Elsevier publishes over 2,500 digitized journals, including The Lancet and Cell, more than 35,000 e-book titles and many iconic reference works, including Gray's Anatomy. Elsevier is part of RELX Group, a global provider of information and analytics for professionals and business customers across industries.

Elsevier employs over 7,000 people in more than 70 offices worldwide. We are an employer of choice, attracting and developing talented and creative people who thrive in a challenging and fast-paced environment. We offer an excellent compensation and benefits package as well as a real opportunity for career growth in a growing organization. Company :Highmark HealthJob Description :

JOB SUMMARY

This job supports the organization through providing complex analytical modeling of the key financial drivers for the company wide planning process as well as new business strategies. Through the maintenance and ongoing improvement of the integrated economic model the incumbent will help internal customers throughout the family of companies to evaluate financial results, identify risks to performance, and establish new financial processes to support an evolving business.

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES
Conduct financial and business related analyses / research including data summaries, trend analysis, and projection development in support of new business strategies across the organization
Develop the enterprise forecast for key business drivers through detailed financial planning / modeling and cross-functional collaboration
Establish and maintain strong working relationships with customers of all levels through regular interaction with business leaders and data experts throughout the company and its subsidiaries
Ensures data integrity and quality through the ownership of data gathering, auditing, and governance processes to ensure efficient and consistent data flows to business / stakeholders
Create and deliver presentations to all levels of management in order to provide a summary of analysis regarding financial results and trends.
Other duties as assigned.
EDUCATION

Required
Bachelor's Degree Business Administration/Management, Data Analytics, Finance, Managerial Economics, Actuarial Science, Operations Management or Statistics
Preferred
Master's Degree in Business Administration/Management
EXPERIENCE

Required
5 - 7 years in Finance or Data Analytics
0 - 1 year in IT Application - SAS
Preferred
1 - 3 years in IT Application - SAS
1 - 3 years in the Healthcare Industry
SKILLS
Financial Forecasting and Modeling
Data Gathering and Analysis
SAS
Microsoft Excel
Analytical and Logical Reasoning/Thinking
Analysis of business problems/needs
Oral & Written Communication Skills
Relationship-builder with Unsurpassed Interpersonal Skills
Self Starter

Job Description
IBM Global Business Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants enabling enterprises to make smarter decisions and providing unparalleled client and consumer experiences via Cognitive data analytics, cloud technology and mobile app development. With global reach, outcome-focused methodologies and deep industry expertise, IBM GBS empowers clients to digitally reinvent their business and get the competitive edge in the cognitive era in over 170 countries.

IBM is a leader in this global transformation, and there is no better place to launch or further your career. World-class learning opportunities, mentoring and a flexible work environment
you will find a wealth of opportunities within IBM to create the career youve always imagined.

This is our vision for the future of Data Analytics
our belief in the rise of you
this is: You to the power of IBM.

What Does an IBM Cognitive Engineer Opportunity Offer?
Experience - Consulting experience and client interaction on challenging projects
Education & Training - Ongoing learning and development opportunities
Networking & Professional Development - IBM leadership and peer networking opportunities
Supportive and dynamic team work environment
Compensation our employees enjoy a competitive compensation package

What Will You Do as an IBM Cognitive Engineer Consultant?
We offer exceptional consulting opportunities to work with some of the brightest minds in the business in the Digital practice within the Analytics and Cognitive Computing domains, specifically in the areas of Big Data, Cognitive Computing, Data Science. Our Cognitive Engineers work as members of engagement teams, often at client sites, to bring value to our clients. Youll join a team that combines sophisticated data analytics with market-leading global solutions, deep industry insight and business consulting expertise.

Our opportunities are in one of the following core skill areas:

Big Data & Analytics - Provide business insights to IBM clients through innovative solutions and services for both structured and unstructured data.
If your expertise is working with structured data; apply methods, techniques & technologies that address data architecture, integration and governance of data. Utilize experience in database concepts, data modeling; data integration including design and architecture. Master data management, including customer data strategy, product data strategy and organizational hierarchy, and Information (data) Governance including strategy, implementation, business glossary, metadata and industry frameworks. Tasks include data mapping, detailed data analysis and metadata analysis and providing hands-on business knowledge working with database developers, DBAs, architects, data quality analysts, and other teams while seamlessly managing client relationships within context of individual role.
If your expertise is working with unstructured data; ability to apply semantic correlation, ontology and text analytics techniques and systems to analyze non-structured data and identify critical insights for overall business analytics across various domains. Experience in analyzing text, streams, documents, social media, speech and video with emerging Hadoop-based big data, NoSQL, Natural Language Processing (NLP), Search and Text analytics technologies and techniques. Possess solid skills in Java, C++, Python, or Skala development and a good understanding of working with Hadoop.

Cognitive Computing - Provide business insights to IBM clients through innovative solutions and services for unstructured data using IBM's Watson Cognitive approach. The combination of the following capabilities makes Watson unique:
Natural language processing by helping to understand the complexities of unstructured data
Hypothesis generation and evaluation by applying advanced analytics to weigh and evaluate a panel of responses based on only relevant evidence
Dynamic learning by helping to improve learning based on outcomes to get smarter with each iteration and interaction. This combination delivers a powerful solution:
To move beyond the constraints of programmatic computing
To move from reliance on structured, local data to unlock the world of global, unstructured data
To move from decision tree-driven, deterministic applications to probabilistic systems that coevolve with their users
To move from keyword-based search to an intuitive, conversational means of discovering a set of confidence-ranked responses. If your expertise is with unstructured data and advanced analytics; ability to apply semantic correlation, ontology and text analytics techniques and systems to analyze non-structured data and identify critical insights for overall business analytics across various domains. Experience in analyzing text, streams, documents, social media, speech and video with emerging Hadoop-based big data, NoSQL, Natural Language Processing (NLP), Search and Text analytics technologies and techniques. Possess solid skills in Java or C++ development and a good understanding of working with Hadoop, Artificial Intelligence (AI) or other cognitive computing technology.

Data Science - Responsible for successful delivery of data science solutions and services in a client consulting environment; experience in predictive modeling, optimization, and/or machine learning analytics techniques using tools/programming languages including SPSS, SAS, R, Python, Spark, etc. within a Hadoop-enabled environment. Define key business problems to be solved; formulate mathematical approaches and gather data to solve those problems, develop, analyze/draw conclusions, test solutions and present to client. Enhance performance by applying advanced mathematical modeling, data analytics, optimization, and machine learning techniques.

Full Stack Engineer - As a Full Stack Engineer, you will be to work on these solution across the entire tech stack. You will work with databases, distributed systems, microservices, message bus/queues, and frontend user interfaces.
Develop highly scalable microservices / RESTFUL Services and APIs
Develop user-friendly interfaces and dashboards , translation of designer mockups and wireframes into front end code .
Write unit and integration tests
Build instrumentation and metrics for monitoring and alerting systems
Document your work Research and implement new technologies to solve customer problems
Experience in Python - Flask, Django, Java - Springs framework, JavaScript - Node JS, Express, FrontEnd frameworks - React JS/Angular/Vue.js, container services - Kubernetes.


Required Technical and Professional Expertise

Drivers License
2+ years of prior consulting &/or relevant work exp in one of the following industries: Communications (Media & Entertainment, Telecom, Utilities), Distribution (Customer Package Goods, Pharmaceutical, Retail, Travel & Transportation), Financial Services (Banking, Financial Markets, Insurance), Industrial (Aerospace & Defense, Automotive, Chemicals & Petroleum / Industrial Products, Electronics), Healthcare & Life Sciences
Possess required skills and education associated with Predictive or Business Analytics; Business or Marketing Intelligence; Computer Science; Computer Information Sciences and Technology; Computer or Management Information Systems; Information Technology; Applied Mathematics; Applied Statistics; and Operations Research


Preferred Tech and Prof Experience

Ability to define key business problems to be solved, formulating approaches and gather data to solve those problems, develop/analyze/draw conclusions and present solutions.
Demonstrated leadership skills
A passion for innovative ideas, coupled with the ability to understand and assimilate different points of view
Capacity and eagerness to learn new assignments, systems, and tools
Aptitude for technology tools and applications
Issue-based consulting skills
Ability to thrive in an intense team atmosphere while making individual contributions
Ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently and meet deadlines



EO Statement
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

job_description:
PPG's R&D Library Shared Services team is seeking qualified and experienced candidates for the position of Information Specialist. R&D Library Shared Services includes experienced patent and technical information professionals who assist R&D researchers, and supports and protects PPG's intellectual property.

As a member of the Library Shared Services Team, the Information Specialist will provide quality information services to PPG scientists, engineers and associates to help support the mission of the team:

To support PPG Science&Technology globally by providing quality information services in a responsive&cost-effective manner

To continue to serve as an innovative&active partner in the research mission of PPG, by facilitating search&discovery&enable communities to manage and act on content.

To explore&implement new&innovative methods to encourage information sharing, improve productivity, foster deeper collaboration&better manage information.

Primary Responsibilities:

* Identifies, understands, interprets, and responds to internal clients information requests for chemical, technical, and patent information, and will develop and modify complex search strategies to conduct searches of electronic resources, as well as use primary and secondary sources, both current and historic.

* Cataloging meta-data and processing internal research documents to a sharepoint portal site to encourage information sharing.

* Processing and ordering book and document requests using in-house resources, and external resources in a fast-paced environment.

* Travel may be required to other research sites in Pittsburgh area.

Basic Qualifications:

Master's degree in Library and Information Science (MLIS) and/or Library Science (MLS) from an ALA-accredited university, with 0-2 years experience working in a research library, or information center. US Citizenship or Permanent Residency required.

Knowledge of scientific and technical literature, reference tools and on-line systems. Proven competence to critically evaluate search results. Ability to assess, select, and apply current and emerging information and data mining tools, including API requests.

Collaborative teamwork abilities. Strong organizational and time management skills, and customer service focus. Must possess both excellent interpersonal and written communication skills. Ability to prioritize work and operate under constant time pressure, manage multiple projects, and deadlines simultaneously.

Preferred Qualifications/Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

* Aware of current practices and new trends in data science.

* Experience with data mining and normalization of raw data using scripting languages such as Python, VBA, and analysis tools such as R. Possess the ability to work with and manipulate common data formats.

* Experience in electronic database searching, including patent and technical information sources, and familiarity with a wide range of free and fee-based patent, business and technical information resources.

PPG: We protect and beautify the world.

At PPG, we work every day to develop and deliver the paints, coatings and materials that our customers have trusted for more than 130 years. Through dedication and creativity, we solve our customers' biggest challenges, collaborating closely to find the right path forward. With headquarters in Pittsburgh, we operate and innovate in more than 70 countries. We serve customers in construction, consumer products, industrial and transportation markets and aftermarkets. To learn more, visit www.ppg.com and follow @ PPG on Twitter.

Why join us:

With PPG, you will find meaning in your work every day, and engage in opportunities that will shape you, personally and professionally.

* Your personal strengths will empower you to succeed and make an impact from day one.

* You will be inspired to learn and grow, and to get the support you need to identify and achieve your boldest career aspirations.

* Your passion to excel will be fueled by your connection to world-class partners, industry experts, the best and brightest colleagues, and future forward technologies.

* Your contributions will not only meet the challenges of our global customers, but help theme propel their industries forward.

* You will be welcomed into a culture where everyone's ideas and contributions are valued and encouraged.

Just like you, we are driven to make a difference in our world.

PPG prides itself on the quality of its employees and as such, candidates who receive a job offer will be required to successfully pass a hair drug/toxins test and a background check.

PPG offers an opportunity to grow and develop your career in an environment that provides a fulfilling workplace for employees, creates an environment for continuous learning, and embraces the ideas and diversity of others. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, pregnancy, race, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability status, protected veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other legally protected status. PPG is an Equal Opportunity Employer. You may request a copy of PPG's affirmative action plan by emailing ppgaap@ppg.com.

OVERVIEW:We re looking for a Business Systems Analyst to join our rapidly growing Agile Project Management team within our Engineering organization.As a Business Systems Analyst, you will be exposed to all facets of the business and be encouraged to learn and develop skills both within and beyond your role. You ll be working in one of the most collaborative offices in Center City Philly, developing and working with machine learning technology, surrounded by passionate, high-performing individuals.The Business Systems Analyst candidate is an organized, self-motivated person that enjoys collaborating cross-functionally and excels with both communication and documentation. REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE:1-2 years of experience working at a technology company or working with software development teamsExperience writing software requirements and acceptance criteria to be interpreted by technical and non-technical audiencesExperience with manual quality assurance testing and user acceptance testingWorking knowledge of software development lifecycle - from research and planning through design, development, testing, and release phasesWorking knowledge of project management methodologies - Waterfall, Scrum, and KanbanTalent for facilitating collaboration among team members of technical and non-technical backgroundsAbility to thrive and lead in dynamic, fast-paced environments PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE:Familiarity with Jira, Confluence, and other common project management toolsProject management experienceCertification or formal education in Agile methodologiesExperience in startup environments RESPONSIBILITIES:As a Business Systems Analyst, your knowledge and diligence will be critical in documenting system requirements and acceptance criteria, verifying development delivery meets those requirements, and communicating system functionality to applicable stakeholders. Business Systems Analysts at Sidecar are not married to a methodology, but instead a mission - to help Project and Product Management empower Engineering to do quality work that meets or exceeds stakeholder needs.Assists technical teams in breaking project goals and deliverables into workable user stories and tasks by gathering system expectations from product management, business stakeholders, and technical teams.Authors, maintains, and obtains approval from required stakeholders on core system documentation including but not limited to system requirements, specifications, acceptance criteria, user acceptance testing scripts, release notes, and system training documentation.Assists project management team in defining the definition of ready for project tasks, to ensure project tasks and requirements are defined enough to enter the development phase.Defines and executes user acceptance testing process based on system requirements, and organizes it within task management tooling. Gains approval from product management on output of user acceptance testing.Collaborates with QA Engineering to facilitate ad hoc manual quality assurance testing of features. Documents system responses, including bugs, if experienced in standard formats.Contributes to creation of release notes or training documentation based on system requirements. OUR ENGINEERING TEAM:At Sidecar, we believe that intelligent technology is the future of e-Commerce marketing. As a member of the Engineering Team, you ll have the opportunity to work alongside talented and passionate Product Managers, Data Scientists, and e-Commerce experts who are all working together to bring that vision to life.We believe that Continuous Delivery, with a focus on quality and technical excellence, is the best way to provide value to our customers and achieve our business goals. You ll have the opportunity to work with both cutting-edge technologies like Kubernetes and Go, as well as tried-and-true tools like Python and Postgres. We actively encourage everyone on the team to contribute to making our culture, product, and technology better.There are many ways to grow your career in meaningful ways at Sidecar. New leadership opportunities arise frequently at a growing company, and we offer training opportunities for areas where you want to improve. WHO WE ARE:Sidecar is dedicated to one mission: Tackling the challenges retailers face in data-driven ecommerce marketing channels like Google and Bing. Based on advanced artificial intelligence, natural language processing, and deep data science expertise, our technology digests and analyzes massive amounts of real-time data to continually improve campaign performance and efficiency in these complex and evolving channels.Our approach - combining deep data, knowledgeable humans, and inspired technology - helps retailers get the most out of their marketing campaigns by aligning digital marketing strategies with the way today's consumers search for products. Sidecar is dedicated to solving the unique challenges faced in retail performance marketing channels, and it shows - we're proud to work with retailers of all sizes and verticals in the U.S. and abroad, including Under Armour, Crate & Barrel, and Boscov's, to name a few.As a company, we work hard to make a lasting impact in the rapidly evolving world of e-commerce marketing, and in the lives and careers of our employees. Our modern work environment and Slack-enabled team encourages collaboration and creativity, and our culture and leadership promote growth as individuals and as a company. Many of us come from e-commerce, statistical, or start-up backgrounds, but we certainly welcome talent with outside perspective and experience. BENEFITS:Competitive salary, based on experienceMedical, dental, and vision coverageCompany-paid disability and life insuranceA company 401(k) planGenerous PTOFlexible scheduleChoose your flavor of device: Mac, Windows, LinuxPre-tax deductions of public transportation costs for your commuteDiscounted gym membershipTeam and social events - provided by Dice

The Digital Campaign Analyst is part of the Digital Analytics team, which responsible for overseeing analytics, data integrity, marketing campaign/website optimization, and support across all AMResorts' digital efforts. The team is comprised of analysts and strategists dedicated to fostering a data-first strategic approach while ensuring accurate, actionable, and timely deliverables. The team is responsible for supporting the broader marketing team’s efforts across the customer acquisition, customer experience, and customer engagement lifecycles. Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to: auditing and analysis of marketing campaign performance/ROI, customer funnel and search analysis, clickstream analytics, user journey optimization, multivariate testing, email marketing analytics, CRM analytics, data visualization efforts, and a wide-range of reporting.

The position works closely with other key stakeholders to identify areas of opportunity in campaign performance across marketing channels and work collaboratively to implement enhancements. Applicant must have superior technical, analytic, strategic and project management skills, with the ability to work independently in an exciting, fast-paced environment.

Essential Duties/Responsibilities:
Execute in-depth performance/ROI analysis across all paid, earned, and owned channels
Supports brand analytic needs by analyzing web traffic using clickstream tools including Google Analytics 360 and Adobe Analytics
Utilize first-party CRM and promotional data to contribute to problem solving across all areas of the business units, marketing, operations, revenue management and distribution.
Leverage in-house and external data, tools and methodologies to develop data-centric recommendations for the best marketing strategies to deploy
Assist in the planning and management of SEO strategy, SEO/SEM opportunity analysis, and other top-of-funnel tactics to drive qualified traffic.
Enable AMResorts to leverage attribution modeling and audience segmentation to inform campaign/budget decisions
Assist in campaign planning, including audience analysis and creative performance via regular testing to ensure efficiencies across all digital platforms.
Lead moderately complex research or analytic projects that involve multiple team members.
Provide analysis of ad hoc research projects including segmentation, benchmarking, attribution modeling, guest insights, branding, customer satisfaction, advertising effectiveness and awareness, attitude, and usage studies
Build strong relationship with agency and other vendor partners to deliver excellent campaign execution.
Partner with other internal team members on key cross-functional initiatives.
Assist in regular training on key analytics tools, trends and topics relevant to internal business teams.
Other Duties as assigned.

Bachelor’s or equivalent 4-year degree (Required fields: Business Information Systems, Business Intelligence, Computer Sciences, Data Management, Statistics, Marketing, or related field)

Founded in 1984, Free People (www.FreePeople.com) is a boutique women's fashion label that operates ecommerce, retail, and wholesale businesses. Free People is the fastest growing URBN brand and has a vibrant ecommerce platform including web, mobile and a newly released iPhone app. Free People is frequently recognized as an industry leader from a technical, creative and innovative perspective. Free People's retail business includes over 100 boutique stores and its Wholesale business includes over 1,400 specialty boutiques and department stores across the globe. Free People is an inspiring shopping experience for the stylish, confident, and curious young woman who appreciates our distinctive assortment of apparel and accessories.

Reports to

Digital Analytics Manager

Overview

Free People is looking for a Senior Analyst to join our Analytics team, as a key member of our larger digital and marketing group. The right candidate will possess a balance of technical-analytics skills alongside big-picture curiosity.

This position is responsible for contributing to the profitable performance of our 'direct' eCommerce business primarily through: in-depth performance analysis, on-site optimization and testing, feature tracking and enhancement recommendations.

Responsibilities
Track, analyze and report on site and general business performance
Transform data into actionable, strategic insights
Make recommendations and implement ideas to optimize the site experience

SQL and database experience a plus

Experience managing projects and coordinating deliverables
Flexible and creative problem solver

Bachelor's Degree in Business Analytics, or a related field.

job_description:
OVERVIEW:

We are looking for a Cloud Engineer, with a focus on Kubernetes and AWS, to join our rapidly growing Engineering team.

As a Cloud Engineer, you will be exposed to all facets of the business as you build the next generation of infrastructure to support product development at Sidecar. You’ll be working in one of the most collaborative offices in Center City Philly, developing and working with machine learning technology, surrounded by passionate, high-performing individuals.

The Cloud Engineer candidate is an intelligent, motivated person that enjoys collaborating with talented co-workers to solve complex problems and make a meaningful impact on a team.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE:
Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) and an understand the different services that AWS offers
Experience creating and maintaining DevOps infrastructure on cloud platforms
Expertise and hands on experience with Containers (Docker) and orchestration (Kubernetes)
Proficient in scripting languages such as Python, Javascript, or Bash
A strong critical thinker and problem solver with the ability to innovate and lead the team in the candidate's area of expertise
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE:
Ansible
Terraform
Linux System Administration experience
Continuous Integration and Deployment (CI/CD)
Experience with Go programming language
Experience in startup environments
Experience in the advertising/ad tech industry
RESPONSIBILITIES:

As a Cloud Engineer, you will be building the foundation for distributed, scalable, cloud-based systems to support Sidecar’s e-commerce applications. We are building a microservice-based system with a centralized API and user interface to support our growing client base.
Improve our infrastructure platform by automating manual tasks, reducing points of failures, and ensuring high availability of Sidecar systems.
Work with Product teams to understand requirements and recommend improvements to Sidecar infrastructure and provide a solid platform for development.
Take part in our continuous delivery workflow in order to allow teams to deploy/rollback quickly, without any downtime.
Build and maintain tools for monitoring and logging of Sidecar systems with customizable alerting.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues in our development, test and production environments
Follow and help improve Sidecar's standards for design, coding, testing, and documentation
OUR ENGINEERING TEAM:

At Sidecar, we believe that intelligent technology is the future of e-Commerce marketing. As a member of the Engineering Team, you’ll have the opportunity to work alongside talented and passionate Product Managers, Data Scientists, and e-Commerce experts who are all working together to bring that vision to life.

We believe that Continuous Delivery, with a focus on quality and technical excellence, is the best way to provide value to our customers and achieve our business goals. You’ll have the opportunity to work with both cutting-edge technologies like Kubernetes and Go, as well as tried-and-true tools like Python and Postgres. We actively encourage everyone on the team to contribute to making our culture, product, and technology better.

There are many ways to grow your career in meaningful ways at Sidecar. New leadership opportunities arise frequently at a growing company, and we offer training opportunities for areas where you want to improve.

WHO WE ARE:

Sidecar is dedicated to one mission: Tackling the challenges retailers face in data-driven ecommerce marketing channels like Google and Bing. Based on advanced artificial intelligence, natural language processing, and deep data science expertise, our technology digests and analyzes massive amounts of real-time data to continually improve campaign performance and efficiency in these complex and evolving channels.

Our approach - combining deep data, knowledgeable humans, and inspired technology - helps retailers get the most out of their marketing campaigns by aligning digital marketing strategies with the way today's consumers search for products. Sidecar is dedicated to solving the unique challenges faced in retail performance marketing channels, and it shows - we're proud to work with retailers of all sizes and verticals in the U.S. and abroad, including Under Armour, Crate & Barrel, and Boscov's, to name a few.

As a company, we work hard to make a lasting impact in the rapidly evolving world of e-commerce marketing, and in the lives and careers of our employees. Our modern work environment and Slack-enabled team encourages collaboration and creativity, and our culture and leadership promote growth as individuals and as a company. Many of us come from e-commerce, statistical, or start-up backgrounds, but we certainly welcome talent with outside perspective and experience.

BENEFITS:
Competitive salary, based on experience
Medical, dental, and vision coverage
Company-paid disability and life insurance
A company 401(k) plan
Generous PTO
Flexible schedule
Choose your flavor of device: Mac, Windows, Linux
Pre-tax deductions of public transportation costs for your commute
Discounted gym membership
Team and social events
provided by Dice

Crown Castle works around the country to build and maintain the infrastructure behind the world’s most revolutionary technologies. Crown Castle owns, operates and leases more than 40,000 cell towers and over 60,000 route miles of fiber supporting small cells and fiber solutions across every major US market. This nationwide portfolio of communications infrastructure connects cities and communities to essential data, technology and wireless service – bringing information, ideas and innovations to the people and businesses that need them. Crown Castle is an S&P 500 company and one of the largest Real Estate Investment Trusts in the United States with an enterprise value of approximately $60 billion.

Position Title: Senior Data Analyst – Internal Audit

Position Summary

The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for providing accurate, complete and meaningful reports and analysis used to supplement internal audits, continuous controls monitoring, business management and decision making. The Senior Data Analyst works closely with department and/or functional managers to determine report requirements, build reports, and quality test them prior to distribution. The Senior Data Analyst also provides direction to the Internal Audit team for data analytics methodology and strategy.

Determines report and dashboard development and design.Tests reports and dashboards and ensures that they perform as expected.
Understands flow of data internally and in relation to the General Ledger and other critical data sources.

Analyzes large amounts of data and investigates and researches anomalies.Works with department and/or functional teams determine root cause for these anomalies.
Works with IT Business Intelligence team to design, test and deploy MRE reports for general usage.
Provides support to management to produce reports and analyze large amounts of data as part of acquisitions or other special projects.
Produces ad-hoc reporting as assigned.

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience

Five (5) years reporting and analysis experience
Experience working with end users

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

Ability to summarize large amounts of complex data into management reports
Knowledge of JDE and other data analysis and financial software and tools
Ability to problem solve to determine root causes of anomalies
Understand and write reports using various software and tools
Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities
Responds well under pressure with deadlines
Organizational Relationship
